39400037.review:
Хигураши - помню дни, когда я взахлеб читал эту серию новелл, пытаясь понять, что же там происходит, как переживал за героев в напряженные моменты истории и как смеялся с их выходок в моенты спокойствия и веселья. Первая часть новеллы смогла меня знатно напугать: как общая атмосфера, заданная загадочным саундтреком и фото-фонами, так и сюжет, который медленно перетекает из непринужденной веселой истории в жуткий триллер. Это серия новел является кинетической - здесь нет выбора, вы просто читаете текст, как книгу, дополненную картинками, звуками и музыкой. Когда Плачут Цикады делится на 2 части: 4 главы загадок и 4 главы ответов. В главах загадок на протяжении всего повествования вам будут даваться подсказки - маленькие звенья, помогающие понять целую историю мира Хигураши; однако эти звенья начнут выстраиваться в четкую цепь только после ознакомления с последующими эпизодами. Каждая глава будет давать свои загадки, не давая ответов. Ответы должны искать вы сами, пользуясь подсказками и канвой сюжета. Главы ответов расставят все по полочкам; вы сможете сравнить свои теории и просто насладиться раскрытием всех тайн (хотя некоторые вещи все равно придется додумать самому).
Когда я проходил эту игру в первый раз, то играл в оригинальную версию с фото-фонами, старенькой музыкой и героями с руками-боксерскими перчатками. Я очень рад, что в этой версии остались фоны и музыка, а вид персонажей можно поставить по-своему усмотрению.
Видел, что некоторым не нравится наличие таких музыки и фонов, хотя по мне именно такой стиль и создает атмосферу тайнственности и некой ностальгии одновременно. Я очень люблю эти треки и до сих пор часто их переслушиваю. Да, возможно, что новый вид персонажей не сходится с таким антуражем, но их, повторюсь, можно сменить на старых, если вам этого захочется (новые спрайты, кстати, довольны неплохи, как по мне). 
Эта серия новелл хорошо сочетает в себе как комедию, так и триллер, детектив и мистику. По ходу глав персонажи отлично раскрываются и мы видим события игры глазами разных героев, как детей, так и взрослых, видим их развитие, переломные моменты в жизни, секреты, что они прячут и многое другое. Очень надеюсь, что в скором времени выпустят остальные 3 главы серии.
Напоследок скажу, что аниме адаптация потеряла почти 2/3 сюжета (хотя некоторые сцены вышли очень хорошо), так что если хотите погрузиться в мир Цикад поностью, то читайте новеллу. Не торопитесь прочесть все на одном дыхании, присматривайтесь к мелочам и странностям, ищите связи между главами. Это будет интересно. И, конечно, самое главное - да, сюжет в каждой главе отматывается назад во времени с уже другим его развитием - так надо, просто примите это, потом сами все поймете. Надеюсь, что от этой серии новел вы получите такое же удовольствие, как и я.

39358241.review:
Higurashi no Naku Koro ni is one of my favorite visual novels of all time. From humble beginnings, it develops some of the most spectacular, lovable characters I've ever encountered in fiction and puts them in an extremely well thought out story, with very solid BGM (especially in the latter 4 chapters) that always suits the situation at hand. It's a story that will always be very near and dear to my heart.

P.S: The original sprites will look ugly to you at first. It doesn't matter. Use them. The new sprites are well drawn but are completely and utterly soulless.

39353480.review:
I’d heard about the Higurashi series for quite a few years now, but had never actually watched the anime or played the games that the anime series was based off of. So, I was relatively surprised to see that not only was this a visual novel, but that it played a bit differently than other visual novels I’d played.

It’s true in that it's exactly that- a visual "novel". There’s not really anything to play. There are no choices given to the player, nor is there anything you can do to alter the route or ending. That being said, I didn't particularly mind.

The characters are likably tropey in that 2002-era style, and the story lures you into a false sense of security before pulling the rug out from beneath your feet. I really, truly enjoyed this game. It had me hooked and playing until 3AM, and I’m very excited to continue the series!

39172570.review:
I had already watched the Higurashi anime, so I pretty much knew what was going to happen in this visual novel already. The two are actually very similar, with the VN being a little bit more in depth. The VN only covers part of the anime, which makes sense since this is only chapter 1. However, the visual novel does have some good parts of it, and being able to control the pace is really nice.

The bad part of this visual novel is that the beginning is way too slow. There is way too much unnecessary banter and exposition in parts that don't really matter. Do you really need to show exactly what card was played in a card game and what thoughts were going on? If they dove into the suspense and content a bit faster, it would have been better, but I am looking forward to the next 4 chapters to see how they will pan out compared to the anime.

Overall, I would say that it might be a bit faster for your time to just watch the anime, but the Visual Novel is not bad. Also its an easy 100% achievement game (just play through it and the extra).

Rating: 8.0/10
Recommend Price: $4.99 or below

39151323.review:
Ah from where should I start to review this beautiful masterpiece. More than five years ago I played the visual novel after watching both HIgurashi No Naku Koro Ni and Umineko Naku Koro Ni - just up to chapter onikakukshi. The first wallpaper I ever made was for Keiichi Maebara one of my favorite protagonists of all time. Being a girl and watching plus reading the VN even though it was not reverse harem was nothing for me. This VN is a pure masterpiece along with the anime. The anime which was considered as the mother of all horror anime for me will always be Higurashi. 

Back then when Yuno Gasai wasn't around the dazzling yandere stage was kept up by Ryugu Rena mostly and for me it's still her. Following the start up atmosphere of Doki Doki Literature Club aka starting from a bubbly atmosphere to a sudden dangerous scary one is Higurashi's one specialties. More than that- the VN starts with the saying of one of the most greatest characters in Umineko called Frederica Bernkastel : The witch of miracles. Keep in mind that this is a kinetic visual novel with no well choosing options and etc. But seriously even without that and reading it for the second time it still makes me so depressed, scared and angry. This is Ryukushi 07's epic masterpiece although he does have other stories written. He was always enthusiastic about marketing his works outside Japan- such a sweet heart :3

You don't have to do anything to get the achievements just keep reading the hell up including all tips and the Cast Review thingy in the Extra menu. The only thing that was lacking was the voices. But, artwork has been seriously remade which is admirable. For the voices- I heard the PS3 version had em' and in the steam community guides there is a particular walkthrough to get the voices. I didn't add em of course because I found it after the story was close to over- but now I'm itching to start the chapter two I might alter that one if there is a voice patch in there. Well the overall is - still a great amazing visual novel of the horror mystery genre. This game has me ITCHING and SCRATCHING to watch the anime all over again :3

39063141.review:
I want to start this off by saying that I am trying to get into visual novels, so this review is for people like me who haven't really played them before. I knew about Higurashi and had seen the first season of the anime, so when I saw the bundle on sale I figured what the heck.

Higurashi, When They Cry: Ch1 is a visual novel, meaning there is little to no interaction or choice.  You will read the story as it is presented to you, evaluate new tips between segments, and follow the progress of the protagonist, Keiichi. It's also important to note this is Ch1 of the four chapter questions arc. Don't expect the mysteries to be wrapped up in a nice bow by the end. You'll leave with more questions than answers.

So, what a ride! The characters have good chemistry and aren’t slapped together cliches. The mystery aspects are captivating. I'm a huge horror fan and don't get scared easily, but there were moments when I found myself glancing over my shoulder and feeling really [i]really[/i] creeped out. The anime didn't come close to doing that for me. I cannot wait to start episode 2. If you like anime or just don't mind sitting back and reading a scrolling story, I would give this a shot, especially if it's on sale. You're going to put in a LOT of time reading it, so set up the auto scroll and sit back and relax. If you can, play in a dark room alone with headphones in. Story is a slow burn but worth it.

Oh, and I played with and without the PS3 patches, and I have to say: get the patches! It's sort of mind numbing without them. You can search for the links, I found them on a reddit post. Seems sketchy but install worked fine.

39007318.review:
Christ, where do I start. Ok, here goes, so, im not really an anime/manga type of person. Theres some good animes, and theres some good mangas, just not really my thing.  Then theres Higurashi. See i started by trying out Doki doki Literature Club, right? Next thing i know steam wants me to know about every visual novel available on the platform, almost kind of annoying, as i only played one, and so many more of other games. Why is this important? Shut it, im getting there. Over the holidays i was doing the que thing and getting the trading cards, then this "game" popped up. I read most of the store page, some reviews, and decided for a 2 bucks, at worst i could refund it if i wasnt interested. 14 hours later I was purchasing the chapter 2, i currently own all 5. I guess my point here is, you dont need to be a weeb to get into this. 

Lets cover something first while were in the middle, this game has a preset difficulty thats mentioned when you first start. One may wonder, "why does this book have a difficulty?", and the answer is simple, How hard did you try to understand and figure out what was going on. Thats the game, understanding. 

So lets cover some pros
Amazing story, i mean its nuts. 
Character depth is phenominal, each person in the story has their own unique personality and traits.
The music is fairly catchy
easy to pick up and put down as neccessary

of course theres some downsides
Its written kind of like a book, so at times it can be ahrd to tell whos saying what, but not overly so
the ui kind of sucks
the orignal backgrounds look funny
the original artwork is absolute hot garbage, thank god for the updates

Overall, after reading all 5 available on steam, Im eager to read the rest (i think 14 in the whole story), The story has been enthralling thus far. youll laugh, maybe cry (dont be a weenie), be shocked, confused, anxious, and downright angry a times. maybe youll get those shivers and chills down your spine, goosebumps like i did as the story starts to develop. It has a super slow start (chapter 6 or so is when it starts to kick off, hard too.) but damn does it turn into a ride. And it only gets better as the music begins to vary more, and starts to match the situations better. 

There are patches that add the ps3 character sprites, background, and i think voice overs, however as with most games, i would reccomend you experience this "vanilla" your first time thru.  

Also some really easy achievments here (yes, they have achievements) if your an achi hunter. cant argue with that. 

This is a fantastic place to start your visual novel experience, or to add to your current collection. After this, i myself intend to look into the anime and manga of this.

39004760.review:
Da ich den Anime kenne und nun das Visual Novel dazu ausprobieren wollte, bin ich hier gelandet und bereue es nicht. 
Das Spiel ist viel ausführlicher gestaltet als der Anime. Es gibt mehr Details zu Dingen bei denen man sich fragt "Warum ist das jetzt auf einmal so?". Hier werden alle Fragen beantwortet die man sich beim Anschauen des Animes vielleicht gestellt haben könnte. 38994329.review:
Купив игру и почитав её с час я полностью вспомнил все проблемы, с которыми я столкнулся при прочтении манги, когда-то.
1)Нереальная дробность истории.  В каждой части после первой мы читаем 70% "пустого" текста в котором мы не узнаем ничего нового и лишь гдето под конец начинают проявлятся новые детали и хоть как то начинает двигаться сюжет. Уже на 3 арке я стал попросту скипать значительную часть дабы не читать весь этот словесный мусор и узнать чем же закончится история. Не было АБСОЛЮТНО НИКАКИХ причин делать игру так. 
2)Подача сюжета нулевая, под сюжетом подразумеваю основную историю а не повседневную часть жизни героев. Как только начинает происходить чтото интересное - БАХ - мы снова в начале, додумывай что случилось дальше сам. В игре люто непонятна очередность событий, особенно, когда пытаешься соотнести события разных частей. В итоге нет никаких мыслей кроме как "ЧТО Я БЛ*ТЬ ТОЛЬКО ЧТО ПРОЧИТАЛ?"
3)Даже если бы предыдущих двух минусов не было это бы никак не поправило убогость основной истории, если выкинуть из нее всю хрень, которая явно была нужна просто чтобы растянуть одну новеллу НА ЦЕЛЫХ 8 ЧАСТЕЙ НА*УЙ (что ж не на 17 то?) то мы получим очень посредственную детскую страшилку в которой происходит какая то хрень, большей частью вызывающая не испуг а недоумение.

В общем серьезно, то ли я уже прочитал слишком много тайтлов, то ли, покупающие эту новеллу, люди слишком мало, но я вообще не понимаю как подобная игра могла получать высокие оценки в принципе. И да,мой обзор и оценка скорее не игре а тайтлу Higurashi When They Cry Hou в целом, потому как я смотрел и аниме, и мангу, и, теперь вот, еще и новеллу попробовал.

38900308.review:
[h1]一处信仰鬼神的村落，一曲盛夏寒蝉的悲歌。
也许见证了发生过一切的，只有不断鸣泣的寒蝉了吧。[/h1]


我入宅一年了，也算是简单接触了各种类型的作品，不过只有两种要素的诱惑我无法拒绝：一是充满生机的夏天，二是民风淳朴的农村。所以我在补完《AIR》之后就彻底爱上了KEY社，补完《元气囝仔》和《花开伊吕波》都毫不犹豫地评了9分。

前段时间室友在寝室练琴，我一听感觉这音乐特别棒，就问他这是什么音乐。知道了名字叫做《you》出自《寒蝉鸣泣之时》。简单了解了一下发现我最喜欢的两种要素都包含在这部作品中。于是就把它加入了愿望单。

后来HB出了个死宅包，于是我买了个十刀包准备体验一下这部作品。发现第一篇居然有汉化！在这里要感谢@ycx 大大的辛苦劳作！[u][url=https://tieba.baidu.com/p/5279750679]贴吧汉化地址点我[/url][/u]同时期待后续章节的汉化~


游戏本身无配音无中文，因为我安装的汉化是带语音的版本，为了听全语音花了10个小时才完结第一篇，后四篇暂时没推，有很多事情在我心里还是谜团。这次给出这篇评测主要还是想来刷个好评。

[h1]假装我是一条分割线（才不是因为不会弄呢）[/h1]

推完第一篇之后我立刻就释然了，御社神大人的光芒照亮了在黑暗中慌乱的我，安抚了我恐惧无助的内心。同时蕾娜酱的微笑也在滋润着我的心田，好像在说：“《寒蝉鸣泣之时》那么可爱，一定要给它好评哦~”
虽然前面的日常冗长又无聊，但是进入主线剧情之后我的整个心境都随之改变了。那是一种信徒般的心境，蕾娜酱和魅音酱的谆谆教诲让我了解到御社神大人对信徒的温柔，对无神论者的宽容，还有御社神大人为了保护雏见泽村的一切而操碎了心的伟大。在我完成了鬼隐篇的捧读之后，伴随着御社神大人的光芒我很安稳地进入了甜蜜的梦乡。


[spoiler]上面分割线以下的话全部向相反的极端方向想，就是我想说的关于本篇即鬼隐篇的话了。[/spoiler]

最后，虽然应该是一个凉透了的梗，但我还是忍不住想要吐槽：

Мне очень жаль что ни задний фон, ни визуализированниые персонажи не тем более музыка не влияют на атмосферу в обще. С музыкой еще печальней ведь она не только не участвует, но еще и вредит. К примеру звучащая часто в этой главе мелодия [i],,Hello''[/i] является настолько низкого качества что портит впечатление о новелле. Поиграв минут 7-15 понимаешь что 95 % атмосферы составляет лишь текст. В итоге получается этакий дисбаланс, когда текст впереди, а остальное еще на старте. Что я считаю новелле такое непростительно. Хуже всего то как разработчики отнеслись к steam версии игры. Большинство задних фонов вырезано, вырезанные также иллюстрации. Steam версия игры разделена по главам. Сами же главы (с 1 по 4) кроме текста в них ничем друг от друга не отличаются. Так все выше перечисленные минусы новеллы сильно ставят под сомнение ее покупку.

Теперь к самому главному: [i] ,,Если все так плохо тогда почему вы написали положительный обзор ? '' [/i]
Превосходно в этой новелле только одно из-за чего мигом забываешь все минусы и это.....

[spoiler] С.Ю.Ж.Е.Т. [/spoiler]

Он прост и одновременно гениален. Диалоги и персонажи на высоте. Радует то что персонажи всегда мыслят только из ходя своего характера, не состыковок в тексте мало. Юмор разнообразен. Из особых плюсов (для меня лично.) то что здесь настолько умело нагнетается атмосфера страха, настолько же разряжается напряженная обстановка. И в плане как детектива не огорчили несмотря что эта глава позиционируется как такой некий пролог к одной большой повести разгадка тайны все время у нас была перед носом, но нам тайны раскроют намного позже, в других главах. Концовка хоть и показалась лично мне немного мутной, но все ж не огорчила.
И поэтому я считаю что несмотря на все недостатки лучше новеллы которая качественно объединяет в себе и мистику и драму и хорор и детектив (хоть он здесь и слабенький) вам не найти, да еще читается на одном вздохе.

Итог: юмор 7/12, Музыка 3/12, Сюжет(диалоги) 10/12, Концовка 10/12.

38678940.review:
Higurashi When They Cry Hou (ou "Quando as cigarras choram") é o primeiro jogo da saga de visual novels "Higurashi When They Cry", essa é uma série de terror psicológico que conta a história de um grupo de amigos de uma escola na pequena cidade de Hinamizawa. O jogo aborda um período de 2 semanas durante o verão do ano de 1983, nesse período tu és apresentado ao grupo, sua vida cotidana e lendas misteriosas da região, mais especificamente a uma série de assassinatos que ocorrem todos os anos pouco depois de um festival que ocorre na cidade. Todo o ano depois de um certo evento - o governo central tentou construir uma represa na região que iria inundar toda a cidade no ano de 1979, o projeto acabou sendo abortado depois de incidentes que culminaram no assassinato do responsável pela obra e no sumiço de uma pessoa - uma pessoa morre ou é assassinada e outra some, alguns dizem que isso é a maldição de Oyashiro-sama (o deus da cidade). 

O jogador assume a perspectiva de Keiichi Maebara, um aluno recém transferido, filho de um artista que veio a cidade para se inspirar para a elaboração de sua obra. No jogo pouco é falado específicamente sobre a família de Keiichi Maebara. A obra pode ser dividida em três partes, o começo onde és apresentado a cidade, o grupo de amigos e as brincadeiras feitas, bem como a sua vida cotidiana, a segunda parte onde o personagem vai ter acesso a informações a respeito desses incidentes e parte para a investigação e a terceira parte onde o personagem totalmente imerso no clima conspiratório acaba tomando medidas extremas. No final de cada capítulo é dado ao jogador dicas a respeito dos acontecimentos de modo que ele possa elaborar suas próprias teses a respeito do mistério, passam desde relatos/depoimentos a arquivos policiais e médicos. 

Em cada um dos jogos da série essas mesmas duas semanas se repetem com eventos se alterando em razão de atitudes diferentes dos personagem, é como se fossem realidades alternativas que dão diferentes perspectivas ao jogador, ajudando-o a desvendar o mistério. A série rendeu um anime de duas temporadas e uma sequência de 5 OVAs --> Higurashi no naku koro ni (26 episódios), Higurashi no naku koro ni Kai (24 episódios) e Higurashi no naku koro ni Rei (5 OVAs) que encerra a história. Recomendo o jogo e o anime fortemente aos amantes do gênero suspense/terror psicológico. Ah, algumas cenas do anime são muito fortes no nível de violência, ou seja, não é algo para ver com as crianças a menos que as queira traumatizar, é aquele anime/jogo enganoso onde os personagens são bonitinhos e carismáticos, mas os temas abordados na obra não são para criança não. Alguns destes temas são de violência doméstica e abuso de drogas só para ter uma noção. Outra cena para te convencer a não assistir com crianças --> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=E3oSg7bNxSg

Importante salientar que nesta visual novel o jogador fica em um modo bastante passivo, pois não me recordo de ter de tomar qualquer decisão no jogo. Boa parte do terror se dá pela leitura e pela música. Outro ponto importante é que é um jogo relativamente fácil de platinar, basta leres tudo, inclusive as dicas que se dão após cada capítulo que está feito o carreto.

38290621.review:
One thing that the visual novel Higurashi manages better than the anime is in being immersive. Play this game alone in the dark, with headphones on and it can definitely be really, quite immersive and spooky. While it cannot boast to have the same level of illustration as many other visual novels, the greatest strength of HIgurashi is in its writing. The characters are likeable, and the story (plus the tips system) are genuinely interesting and clever. The UI is simple and effective. The music can be a bit hit-or-miss, ranging from functional to excellent. The story itself can also be a bit too anime from time to time, but the strong points more than make up for it.

One bitter pill to swallow is the fact that I did watch the Higurashi anime before reading the visual novel. As far as I've seen so far, the anime mirrors the VN quite well. The problem with that is I've already got an idea of what is happening (which does impact the spooky level negatively). I have to say, however, that despite this Higurashi manages to be creepy and I'm enjoying it plenty. Although the VN doesn't handle action quite as well as its anime counterpart, it has the benefit of more internal monologue and substantial depth. It's also incredibly long--I've invested two evenings so far and still haven't completed the first arc, Onikakushi.

I recommend you get this game, but do yourself a favor and make it as immersive an experience as possible. It's definitely worth it, especially if you enjoy intrigue or being spooked.

38167898.review:
Análise escrita por  [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/Hakusei]minha querida mariposa[/url] que jogou pela biblioteca compartilhada.

Higurashi When They Cry - Onikakushi conta a história de Keiichi Maebara, um estudante recém-transferido para a pequena vila de Hinamizawa. O começo do capitulo foca em mostrar sua feliz vida. Keiichi vira membro de um clube escolar, onde suas novas amigas, Sonozaki Mion, Ryuugu Rena, Hojo Satoko e Furude Rika, fazem atividades pós-escola.
De qualquer maneira, esses dias felizes acabam, depois que o menino começa a saber da história passada de Hinamizawa através de Tomitake Jiro, um misterioso fotografo.

Após o leitor obter esta nova informação, os personagens do clube participam de um festival, o festival de Watanagashi, um importantíssimo festival para a vila, e é ai que as coisas ficam interessantes. O fotografo conta o resto da história de Hinamizawa para o garoto, conta de todos os assassinatos e contra também sobre suas vitimas, juntamente de Takano Miyo, que alerta o garoto sobre a maldição da Oyashiro-sama, que mata uma pessoa um dia após o festival. No começo todas as vitimas eram envolvidas com o projeto de construção que houve em Hinamizawa, isso até seu amigo, Tomitake, morrer.

Keiichi é avisado da morte de Tomitake pelo policial Oishi Kuraudo, que se torna um importante personagem na história, revelando segredos sobre Hinamizawa e sobre até mesmo suas amigas, que Keiichi nunca teve ideia de que existiam.

Após a conversa com o policial, as coisas começam a ficar mais sombrias, Rena interroga Keichii e é então que ela solta a famosa frase, ''LIES!''.

A história toma um rumo sombrio com as duas melhores amigas de Keiichi tentando assassina-lo, e ele toma ainda mais conhecimento disso, quando come o Ohagi que as duas preparam para ele, contendo uma agulha.

Com o crescimento da insanidade de Keiichi, ele se torna alguém mais agressivo, suspeitando de que toda a vila queria-o morto. No climax do capitulo de final de Onikakushi-hen, Keiichi faz tudo ao seu alcance para sobreviver, fazendo-o tomar decisões terriveis.

37803987.review:
This review is for the VN as it is presented on Steam, without regard for patches that may require additional user effort to obtain.

The interface--or, really, lack of interface--is a severe blow to the readability of the story.  Every single other VN I have experienced (a total of seventeen, by my count) has as a core part of the interface a way for the reader to tell which character is speaking at any given time.  This VN lacks even this most rudimentary of features, which makes it a puzzle at best to figure out who is actually speaking any given line when multiple characters are present.  Given the dialogue-heavy nature of the story, in my view this is a truly crippling and inexcusable flaw.

Voice-acting would likely alleviate this problem to some degree, but of course there is no voice-acting in the core product.  The result is, to be blunt, an incomprehensible mess, and I find I cannot bring myself to continue the story without an external patch to fix the problem--a patch which has, at least on the first two attempts, not actually worked at all.  That said, even if it does eventually work and I am able to experience and enjoy the resulting product, it is not the product I purchased on Steam, so this review stands regardless.

In the future, I will be sure to confirm the presence or absence of this feature before purchasing a VN.  Unfortunately, I didn't do my research before wasting my money, so all I can do at this point is help warn others away from doing the same.

36974030.review:
A teenage boy Keiichi moves from Tokyo to a small village Hinamizawa with his family. Keiichi quickly become friends with a several girls, and enjoys simple but carefree life in Hinamizawa. But one day, a causal phrase said by a stranger revealed secret that Keiichi’s friends were hiding from him: every year in Hinamizawa one person dies and another mysteriously disappears, and the village festival when it happens is near…

And suddenly Keiichi realizes that he can no longer trust the people he thought of as friends. And when he takes a second look, their previously friendly smiles start looking sinister, and behind seemingly innocent phrases are threatening second meanings… 

Will Keiichi find out the truth behind Hinamizawa’s disappearances, before it’s too late?

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

When Cicadas Cry is a kinetic novel, meaning there are no dialogue choices: you just read the story as if it was an illustrated book.

The story is top-notch, and I fully recommend When Cicadas Cry series to everyone who enjoys a good story.

36429432.review:
Higurashi When They Cry is good VN but it has some serious issues.

First i must say that story is tense dark and pretty good BUT, only in second half of VN, first half is just booring cutesy stuff.

Game feels very low budged, there is no voice acting and backgrounds are just lightly modified photos. Character sprites are OK and there are variations with different expresions but they are still very basic.

BUT game doesnt have usual text box, instead it just writes text over screen from top to bottom and after few sentences most of screen is covered with text. 

There are no nametags so you have to guess who is saying which sentences, also there is no clear indication which text is said out loud. Sure there are quotation marks for directly spoke words, but often protagonist will talk without quotation marks and other characters still reacts to him. So not only you cant be sure who says what but also you dont know which sentence is actualy spoke out loud.

Honestly if i didnt know that Higurashi is highly acclaimed serie of horror visual novels, i would drop this after half a hour and never touched it again.

I have lot to complain about, considering i gave this positive review, but ultimatly most important aspect of visual novel is story and story in this is really good (after you get thru very boring first half).

36226639.review:
Самими цыкадами я познакомился в аниме адаптаци (не спотря на временаями упорутую рисовку, история очень сильно зацепила), но мной была просмотрена только одоптация первой части из арки "вопросов" и это хорошо.
Решившись ознакомится с этой историей как следую скачал пиратскую версию для пробы и мне понравилось её читать.
И тога без угрызения совести приобрел доступные на данный момент истории.
В кратце постараюсь ответить что в ней меня зацепло:
1)Сюжет 1-3 часть (на данный момент доступно 5) история идёт от лица Мейбара Кейти школьника чья семья переехала в деревню Хинамидзава. И за время проведённое там познакомился и подружиля с интересными персанажами (но о них попозже скажу), и все бы длилось хорошо (учеба, развлечения с друзьями, и всякие интересные приключения на свою голову) однако случайно у зал об убийстве которое произошло в Хинамидзаве, и о пропаже 1 человека в год во время фестиваля Ватанагаши. И сдесь я пожалуй остановлюсь. Добавлю только что об пропавших и убийстве никто из его друзей "якобы не знает". Сама глава является прологом и приготовтесь к тому что с 1-4 вы будете получать ответы но вопросов всёравно будет много. Но скаждым разом вы будете узнавать о персонажах что-то новое и много чего интересного о Хинамедзаве и её жителей
2) Атмосфера сдезь хорошо совшещает в себе (ужасы, детектив, триллер - по правде говаря неплохой, комедию с поседневностью(но сдесь по большомк японский ориентир)) да и аниме адаптация смага передать все это к чему я был удивлен (но всёравно большенство глав было сокращено). Вы не раз будете улыбаться с героем в начале рассказа, но потом от происходящего у вас будут натуральные мурашки покоже и желание нактонеста понять что сдесь происходит.
3) Рисовка-спрайты и задники от manga games мне не нравяся может они и нарисовали милых персонажей, но блин консольная рисовка как и оригинальная на много лучше, осторожно спойлер ко 2-й ([spoiler] части а когда мы встречаем сестру близнеца Мион то на консольных версиях они одинаковы, но манга геймс нарисовала их по разному!!!)[/spoiler].
А задники из пользуются из оригинала, тоесть старые фотографии. Но благо есть возможность скачать спрайты и задники с консольной версии, советую их поставить. И ёще люди ставят японскую озвучка да кому как я лично люблю безнеё (исключение Steine Gate там вся атмосфера терялась без неё).
4)Музыка или лучше всего сказать мелодии подходя под все происходящие действия, но почемута не все мелодии присутствуют так ещё нельзя прослушать их в главном меню (а на консольных версиях можно).
5)Про геймплей я ничего не скажу так как это "кинетическая визуальная новелла", а значит никаких выборов нет, просто читаем сюжет который идёт в одном направлении. И это лучшее решени а иначе авторам бы пришось бы сократить какую нибуть часть историй, да и нам было бы труднее ориентироваться в данной истории. И чуть не забыл что после прочтения открывалась комната актерского состава приятный плюс в том что они говорят свое мнение о произошедшем и строят свои догатки. В такие минуты у меня ощущения что всё произошедшее было всегоишь представлением на сцене.
Да принципе это все что могу сказать.
Из всех минусов для меня было отсутствие CG заставок да это и не критично.
Надесь что обзор был для вас полезен 
И если решии всзять то добавлю что есть руссификатор (и да достижения с ним работают)

35070813.review:
[b]Let me start this off by saying I implore you to download the PS3 Graphics/Voices patch before you play this game. It adds a new sense of immersion which makes it the definitive way to experience these novels, in my opinion[/b]

Whether you're already a fan of the anime/manga or you're dipping into the world of Higurashi for the first time, I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys visual novels. The characters are loveable, the mystery is very interesting and the psychological horror aspect is brilliant in my personal opinion. Even as someone who's watched the anime twice and knew what was going to happen, I still found myself quite spooked on multiple occasions. I was also surprised by how engaged I found myself in it, despite again, having already watched the anime twice. The VN definitely has enough to keep those who enjoyed the adaptions interested, while giving those who jump in for the first time an absolutely captivating experience.

I really only have two complaints. The first is that the pacing can be quite slow at points. Though that's more of a nitpick that applies to the genre as a whole for me and it never drags for very long, so don't even worry about that one. More of a personal peeve than anything else and it never truly affected my enjoyment.

The second complaint is not even about the game itself, but rather the marketing. Despite MangaGamer insisting otherwise, this is a novel through and through. No gameplay is present. I could go on about how this is essentially lying to the consumer but I'll hold my tongue. Personally, I don't mind the lack of gameplay as the story itself was more than enough to keep me invested during all of my playtime. But understandably, the lack of any sort of gameplay or choice will turn off some players. Which is part of why the misleading marketing really annoys me, but I digress 

All in all though, if you enjoy visual novels I implore you to at least check this one out. It's not exactly expensive either, so do yourself a favor and pick it up if you haven't already.  You won't be disappointed.

35012687.review:
想念那一个个消逝的夏天，想念那耀眼的阳光、温暖的风，以及...那一次次清脆悠曳的蝉鸣。
或多或少的牵挂，或悲或喜的命运，好似树上形状各异的叶；有些色泽鲜艳，有些枯黄暗淡，但却有着一样的经络分明，在树上缀满，在风中摇曳。叶的间隙，掩不住阳光，盖不过蝉鸣，更藏不住一次次熟悉的故事，熟悉的人、朋友...
       寒蝉鸣泣之时，关于追溯真相，还原事实的故事。它还原的不仅仅是死亡的真实样貌，更是还原了人性的本来面目。
　　
　　雏见泽,在这个人口不足2000人的小村子里，每年都会发生一些奇怪的事情。
　　雏见泽村连续怪死事件(1979年～1983年)：每年6月的某日，一定会有1人死亡，1人消失，十分离奇。围绕着巨大水库的争斗死亡的惨案连续发生，隐藏在昭和中期的怪事逐个清晰起来了。
　　这是阴谋，是偶然，还是有什么东西在作祟。
　　应该存在的人消失了，不应该存在的人出现了。
　　昨夜相会的人已经死了，现在活着的人也死了。
　　
　　惨剧不可避免。除了屈服别无他法。
　　但是，不能屈服。
　　只有你才能去面对。
　　
　　夜蝉的鸣声依旧，仿佛宣告着这个早来的夏日。
　　
　　人性，是比死亡更让人恐慌且避之不及的存在。
　　每一篇章，都会有一段极其冷静的陈述。
　　每集片尾，都会有一段预告词在进行着极度迫切的追问。
　　
　　《鬼隐篇》
　　请你不要哭泣。
　　即使世间不能原谅你的罪恶，我也将会宽恕。
　　请你不要哭泣。
　　即使你不能原谅这个世界，我也将会从容。
　　所以 请告诉我。
　　我要怎样做 才能得到你的饶恕。
　　1.
　　能相信吗 亲眼所见的事实
　　能相信吗 所发生的事实
　　能相信吗 我
　　寒蝉鸣泣之时 鬼隐篇 其之二 隐情 你 能相信吗？
　　2.
　　你所能看到的 只是虚伪的居所
　　在那能看到的 只是空虚的眼神
　　我所能看到的 只是重演的悲剧
　　寒蝉鸣泣之时 鬼隐篇 其之三 疑心 你 能相信吗？
　　3.
　　请不要畏惧 明日的彼方
　　请不要伤害 你的心灵
　　请不要道歉 昨日的一切
　　寒蝉鸣泣之时 鬼隐篇 其之四 歪 你 能相信吗？
　　4.
　　希望你能凝视 真正的自我
　　希望你能原谅 无常的你
　　希望你能理解 另一个我
　　寒蝉鸣泣之时 绵流篇 其之一 嫉妒 你 能相信吗？
　　
　　《绵流篇》
　　不能治愈你的饥渴。
　　因为追求真实的你 不能认同。
　　不能治愈你的饥渴。
　　因为你所的追求真实 并不存在。
　　尽管如此 还是渴望着满足你的希望。
　　因为把你扔进沙漠的人 正是我自己。
　　1.
　　想见到的 是黑暗中的形状
　　想听到的 是迟疑的脚步声
　　想知道的 是真正的居所
　　寒蝉鸣泣之时 绵流篇 其之二 鹰野 你 能相信吗？
　　2.
　　正在颤抖的 是你的心灵
　　正在靠近的 是黑暗之影
　　正在冻结的 是虚伪的我

I've read the entire Higurashi series and I don't particularly think they're all that great. Now Umineko on the other hand, THAT'S A VN FOR YOU. 

Anyways about this game, it's pretty meh, there's nothing you can do except read. How fun is that? The mysteries are all pretty easy too. And the twist, well forget about it, too much psuedo science / 10. 

If you do like this sort of thing, good for you. I would rather have Studio DEEN do the art though. This is sort of like a more realistic Fate/Stay Night if you like that sort of thing. The original art is awful btw.

The only reason I get this is to support my good friends at MangaGamer, and maybe so I can join in podcasts at the fan community I'm in.

34376542.review:
Jedno trzeba o "Higurashi" powiedzieć: tę powieść trzeba na początku trochę przeboleć. Nie miałam do tej pory większej styczności z gatunkiem, ale zachęcona pozytywnymi recenzjami w "CD Action" i na Steamie, postanowiłam po nią sięgnąć. Każdy ma swoje tempo czytania, więc przedstawię to na swoim przykładzie: całość zajęła mi jakies 13 godzin, z czego pierwsza delikatna wzmianka, że coś tu jest nie tak, pojawiła się po trzech godzinach, a tak naprawdę wszytsko zaczęło się rozkręcać około szóstej. Co jest wcześniej? Piękne, pełne napięcia i emocji opisy... gier w karty. Lekcji WF-u. Wracania do domu ze szkoły.  Pikników. Nie wymagam, by od razu coś się działo, ale na początku to była droga przez mękę. Manga na podstawie nowelki, "Gdy zapłaczą cykady", poradzia sobie z tym lepiej i po prostu skróciła niektóre nudne fragmenty.

... Tylko że manga nie jest w stanie tak bardzo wciągnąć. "Higurashi" to po prostu świetnie napisana powieść i gdy już przejdzie się początkową fazę, to nie można się od niej oderwać, więcej: zaczyna się nawet doceniać te pierwsze rozdziały, bo świetnie budują one i sielankową atmosferę i genialne postaci (acz nie zostałam fanką Reny, a Rika i Satoko chyba muszą poczekać na kolejne części gry, bo tu zostały przedstawione jedynie powierzchownie). Potem, gdy już Keiichi zaczyna prowadzić dochodzenie, robi się tylko lepiej - najbardziej wstrząsnęły mną fragmenty przedstawiające [spoiler]jego paranoję[/spoiler]. Utowrów muzycznych nie jest dużo, ale mistrzowsko podkreślają one klimat (szczególnie ten straszny).

Trzeba miec jednak na uwadze, że mimo zapewnień w opisie wydawcy, nie jest to gra. Nie ma tu żadnych wyborów, a cała ingerencja gracza sprowadza się do klikania, by pojawiła się kolejna partia tekstu. Mam też zastrzeżenia odnośnie angielskiego tłumaczenia. O ile jestem w stanie zrozumieć brak translacji tytułów grzecznościowych, które na język królowej Elżbiety nie przekładają się dobrze, o tyle niezozumiałe onomatopeje, zdania w stylu "I heard the higurashi (cykady) crying outside" czy wreszcie ten potworek-tytuł świadczą tylko o nieudolności tłumacza (vide mem: "Kawaii means cute"). W tej kwestii warto sięgnąć po polskie wydanie mangi, w któym nie ma takich cudactw.

Myślę, że "Higurashi" to bardzo dobra propozycja dla osób, które chcą zacząć przygodę z powieściami wizualnymi, a przede wszystkim świetny horror. Kolejne części już na liście życzeń :)

34272306.review:
Starts slow and silly and slice and life, and then... oh, you will be addicted before you know it.

I think about this series of visual novels so often it's ridiculous. I'm constantly puzzling and marvelling over it.

For all it is so very Japanese and teenage, I recommend it most of all to Agatha Christie lovers, especially those drawn to the more surreal stories like Hallowe'en Party and The Pale Horse... or her horror stories. The complexity of the mystery without cheating is astounding.

If most of the world's visual novels are dating (or fondling) simulators for the lonely and horny, then I'd call this an apt friendship simulator for the lonely and friendless.
Granted, all your friendships end tragically. 
But if you've ever wanted to be friends with a bunch of kids in the japanese countryside in the 1980's, this is most definitely the game for you.

The Graphics for me are the only downside. I reccommend the ps3 graphics patch.

33591923.review:
Pros:
-Fantastic and complex story
-Great pacing
-Nice music
-Real horror, no jumpscares
-Amazing and memorable characters
-Writing is just too good

Cons:
-No gameplay: this game can hardly be called a game, since there is no interaction whatsoever. No choices or anything like that. This is basically just a novel.
-No voice acting
-4:3
Last two cons can be fixed via few patches, which you can find in community guides. But bear in mind that there is slight differences in writing. As far as I learned, voiced version is a little lighter in some sentances. 16:9 patch also changes backgrounds. I feel like original backgrounds is darker and more apropriate for this VN, but you can choose for yourself.

Conclusion:
One of the best VN's I ever read. If you are a fan of horror and mystery genge, this game is the business. Haven't once got scared from reading anything, but this VN gives me chills. Don't read this on weed in a dark room, trust me.
And if you are wondering value-wise, this VN took me about 15-16 hours to read from cover to cover(my reading speed is about average, as far as I can tell). Very well worth full price in my opinion.

33168352.review:
I have just completed this, and I feel compelled to review it. I originally bought it just to see what it was like. I had seen the show several times, I thought it would just be a lot of text to scroll through. It turned out, to be a bunch of text to scroll through. However, what I never thought would happen, did. I thought that having seen the show so many times, there would be no effect. I have never been so wrong. 

First of all, I have to credit the excellent sound design. The music is fantastic, there are energetic and lively tunes, and more sombre slower paced tracks. Not to mention compelling scenes aided by no music at all. The sound effects are crisp, and they all feel like they have actual impact. The cicada cries never become annoying, and they serve as insanely fitting background noise. 

This is a visual novel, and I'd be comitting a crime if I didn't applaud the fantastic writing. Not only is it superbly translated, (From what I can tell, my japanese is a little sketchy) The dialogue is witty, and snappy. You'd think I'd be frowning, sad, or scared the whole time. However, the slice of life sections made me smile and laugh more often than the actual show did. All of the characters speak so naturally, and abide by their characters well. The normal sections are hilarious, and the creepy sections have this undeniable weight to them, as if you are completely sucked into the world. 

The atmosphere is too good to describe. The game can set any scene and it becomes believeable and almost surrealy life like. The simple fact that there is a static image on screen, with words covering a good portion of it, and I am completely immersed is something to praise. The writing, the art, the sounds, they all come together to make the game really transcend its own medium, to become something far more. 

The art, first of all, the characters are absolutely beautifully drawn. From the screenshots, they are far improved from the original versions. They are all far more expressive than I'd think possible. How they can so easily shift from emotion to emotion is incredible. They do reuse the exact same faces and sprites often, however, they never become boring to look at. Also, new ones are occasionally added, the spice things up. Rena in particular has the greatest set of faces in the entire game. Now, the backgrounds are a little disappointing. They all look ok, as I cannot tell if they are photographs with a filter, or water color. Maybe if they were higher resolution, or fitted the characters better, they would be better. However, it is nothign but a minor flaw. 

As for content density, the game itself is about 4-5 hours long. If you read all the tips, and do the after party. Now, I did not use auto mode, nor did I skip all of the text. Also, I read at 606 words per minute, at an average of 250, it would probably be closer to 9-10 hours. Overall, I was surprised with the amount of content there was. The tips flesh out the world, the after party is fun, and the story itself is well written. 

In the end, I cannot reccomend this enough, even if you have not seen the show, this is absolutely fantastic. If you are ok reading it, then I whole heartedly reccomend purchasing this!

33104687.review: This visual novel (and series as a whole) is pretty good, despite the fact that it has essentially no gameplay. It may start off slow, but its still definitely worth reading I'd say. 32923612.review: Классика. Об этой новелле можно говорить и как об отдельно взятом произведении, и как о части серии. Понравится она и тем, кто уже знаком с серией, и тем, кто впервые познакомится с историей Хинамидзавы. Сюжет, постоянно принимающий неожиданные повороты, так характерные для этой серии, гораздо глубже, чем кажется в самом начале. У каждого персонажа своя трагичная история, которая получит несколько вариантов развития, и только единственный из них не приведёт к катастрофе масштаба Хинамидзавы. Мистика красной нитью пронизывает всю историю, связывая её воедино, но при этом никакой мистики здесь нет. Как это может быть? Поймёт лишь тот, кто знаком с творчеством этой студии ;)

32733292.review:
[h1]Лишь далекое пение цикад, словно постоянно двигающаяся секундная стрелка, является фактом неумолимо движущегося времени. Лишь пение проникает в давно забытые коридоры и комнаты, застав в них лишь оставшиеся от хозяев предметы. Лишь пение присутствует в давно забытом крае. [/h1]

Добро пожаловать в Хинамидзаву, как ее называет большинство. Вообще названий у нее несколько. Вон те старики, жившие здесь всю жизнь, по прежнему называют ее "Онигафучи" - так она называлась во временна их детства. Для детей, чьи родители живут достаточно близко, но не относятся к территории деревни, накрепко закрепилось определение "деревни Демонов-людоедов". Неплохо, а? Конечно, это всего лишь старые легенды и слухи. Как я думал.

Вообще деревня очень спокойная. Машины имеют немногие, а народ на удивление приветлив к своим. Наверно действуют местные красоты природы. Леса здесь густы и полны редкой живности с растениями. Почему так мало туристов, спрашиваешь? Ну, можно было бы сказать, что сказываютя мифы о демонах, но, по моему, деревню просто забыли. Хотя когда-то о ней знал чуть ли не каждый второй. Из за чего? Сам узнаешь.

Где? А, та, в милом платье. Это Рюгу Рэна, местная. Что это у нее в руках?

-Кейти-кууун! До-брое у-трооо! Смотри какие плюшевые игрушки я нашла на свалке! Они такие миииленькие, что я не удержалась и забрала их домой. Прости, Кейти, но мне нужно положить их в колекцию. Хауууууу...

Милая? По мне так странная. И есть в ее взгляде что-то холодное, что-то... Будто пережила нечто невообразимое. Что за свалка? Так, горы незаконно сброшенного мусора, в которых она находит "милые" вещи. Не знаю, нормально-ли в ее возрасте там копаться. Да вообще, в любом возрасте. Ладно, пойдем лучше к храму. Оттуда самый лучший вмд на деревню.

Помахай старикам на плантации. Деревня маленькая, о новоприбывших узнают почти сразу, к тому же тебе желательно потдерживать дружеские отношения с местными, так что улыбайся и маши в ответ. Почему тот дед не трудится? Так это Кимиёси, староста Хинамидзавы. Он входит в "Три великих рода " местных правителей. Стой!.. Слышал?.. Вроде тихо. Мой совет: прислушивайся к шагам. Это тебе сильно поможет. 

Вот и знаменитый храм семьи Фурудэ. Да, ступенек многовато, но это дополнительный стимул не бежать от храма по этой стороне. Пойдем, уже не далеко. Говорят, деревня стоит здесь еще с эпохи Мэйдзи, а то и дольше. Понял это по архитектуре домов? Неплохо, очень даже хорошо. Аналитические способности тебе понадобятся. Пошли, обзорная поляна в той стороне. Я уже говорил про густоту здешних лесов? Смотри, заблудиться в них просто, а остаться там не найденным еще легче. Ну, вот и она - Хинамидзава как на ладони. Захватывает, правда? Только горы иногда создают впечатление герметичной площади, хоть вон там и виднеется дорога в ближайший городок.

Нагледелся? А то вечереет, пора бы домой. Это тебе не город - фонарей здесь мало, а во тьме всякое может почудиться. Или не почудиться.   

Видишь девочку с велосипедом у подножия ступеней? Это Фурудэ Рика, владелица храма. Да, такая маленькая, а уже управляет им. Не без помощи взрослых, конечно, но все же. Мило выглядит? Это весь твой спектр описания людей? Хм, не знаю. Мне кажется она слишком много знает. Не в плане каких то секретов, а в плане различной информации, о которой ей не приходилось бы задумываться. Поздороваться с ней? Не успеешь, долго спускаться. 

Люблю я пение вечерних цикад. Оно создает атмосферу оживленности, что ли. А учитывая почти нулевую плотность людского населения на улицах, абсолютная тишина была бы слишком жуткой. Зеленоволосая девушка? Это Сонодзаки Мион, тоже входит в "Три великих рода". Не нравится она мне. Никак не могу понять ход ее мыслей. Только мне показалось, что  мотивация и цели стали мне  ясны, как ее "подменяют", переворачивая все догатки.

-Ооо, Кей-тян, не знала что ты любишь вечерние прогулки. Думала, что ты любишь понежиться вечерком под одеялом. Похоже, дядька Мион в тебе ошибался. Приношу свои глубочайшие извинения. Ладно, у меня собрание в храме, и опаздывать никак нельзя. Бывай! Увидимся в школе!

Что за собрание? Собрание трех родов, что же еще. Обсуждение, планы, интриги. Все по стандарту. А вот и твой дом. Дальше тебе придется без меня, с этим ничего не поделашь. Главное помни, что внешность бывает обманчива, а поступки противоречивы твоим убеждниям.
Удачи.
Она тебе понадобится.

32510512.review:
Wow, this game surely was great. Even though I saw the anime first, this was an exciting experiance indeed. 

[h1]What is it?[/h1]
Higurashi when they cry is a sound novel series. The games use sound effects, images, and appropriate music to generate an atmosphere for the story. (And might I say that do it rather well indeed.) The key characters have sprites to help you get a better idea of their appearance, and their current mood. Images tend to be scenes so you can get the idea of where the character is.

[h1]Story[/h1]
While the game uses all that above to generate a brilliant atmosphere, it wouldn't quite be complete without a story now, would it? Chapter 1 (Onikakushi) is seen as the, shall we say Introduction to the series. (There is more on this matter in the after party.) The rough outline of the story (without spoilers) goes as follows:

You are new to the small village of Hinamizawa. After a few weeks/months of living a normal life there you begin to learn that there is a strange event there every year, one person dies, another goes missing. Some believe this to be a curse, others believe it to be a conspiracy. You are now caught up within it. You, with the help of the detective Ooishi need to find out what the cause of this is, but most importantly you need to survive long enough to bring the truth to light.

With theories like the use of meth, schizophrenia, and even being possessed by a diety, it certainly is interesting. 

Higurashi when they cry puts you in the character's position, you know what he hears, says, sees, and even thinks.
There are optional tips that come up that give you (The player) a chance to observe an incident that the character you are following may not have been in, or know of.
NOTE: This game follows a set path.

[h1]Cost[/h1]
For the experiance, I'd say this game is definately worth the cost. To top it off, it's cheap for the playtime on a single runthrough. (At the time I finished the game once through I had around 14.7 hours playing the game.)

[h1]After Party[/h1]
After you have completed the game, you unlock the "After Party". This is also titled as the "All cast review session". In it, the characters break down the 4th wall and share their opinions on the game, and their theories behind the inccidents, also discussing what the beta players thought. (A surprisingly nice way to end the game, as it doubles up as a brief recap.) It also discusses the preperations for the second chapter (Which I have high expectations for.)

This game, as said above, was great. I just fell into the world they were trying to portray, even after seeing the anime, some elements of the game surprised me.

Why are you still reading this? Haven't you bought the game already?

I literally do not know how this can go on for so many more games when it's as intense as it is RIGHT NOW. My hands sweat the entire time I'm playing and I'm getting sweaty just thinking about it.

能相信吗 亲眼所见的事实

《寒蝉鸣泣之时》是日本同人社团07th Expansion制作的同人游戏系列，《寒蝉鸣泣之时 鬼隐篇》是《寒蝉鸣泣之时》同人系列游戏的第一作，发行于2002年8月16日。《寒蝉鸣泣之时》目前登陆PC,PlayStation 2,PlayStation 3,PlayStation Vita,Nintendo DS,IOS,Android平台，并含有广播剧，电视剧，漫画，小说，动画，真人电影等相关产物。

《寒蝉鸣泣之时》用平行的次元轮回的形式，深刻体现了存在于人们内心深处的罪恶，只有团结一致，才能克服困难，了解一切。游戏没有任何选项，出题篇中通过平行世界的各种角度给出谜题和线索提示，玩家利用线索进行推理，解答篇中玩家才能了解到真正的答案。

《寒蝉鸣泣之时 鬼隐篇》讲述了昭和58年，前原圭一随父母来到雏见泽村。某日，圭一和龙宫礼奈前往垃圾场寻宝时遇到了摄影师富竹次郎，摄影师提起的杀人事件引起了圭一的注意，发现这里是曾经修建水坝的地方。后来，圭一和礼奈回到垃圾场拿东西时，圭一从那里遗留的报刊上看到了和水坝工程有关的杀人事件。一年一度的绵流祭到了，圭一平静的生活从此远去...
你该不会，在抓自己的喉咙吧……

昭和58年的初夏。
现在是6月，对比前几年，夏天仿佛来的更早。
白天可以听到蝉鸣，晚上则有蟋蟀相伴。

我们在一个叫做雏见泽的小村庄。
这个村庄有不到2000人，但每年都会发生一个事件。
这个事件是神秘的死亡。（从1979年到1983年）
在6月的某一天，有人死亡，有人失踪。
一系列的死亡事件和水坝建设项目引起的变动有关。
 一个被掩盖的谋杀事实正在重新上演。
这是阴谋？巧合？还是诅咒？

应该出现在那里的人没有出现在那里。
不应该出现在那里的人却出现在了那里。
昨天还活着的人现在已经死了。
本来应该死去的人却站在了我们的面前。

悲剧无法避免，除了放弃好像没有任何机会。但是请不要放弃。
只有你才能勇敢的面对这些。

你所能看到的 只是虚伪的居所 
在那能看到的 只是空虚的眼神 
我所能看到的 只是重演的悲剧 

请不要畏惧 明日的彼方 
请不要伤害 你的心灵 
请不要道歉 昨日的一切

希望你能凝视 真正的自我 
希望你能原谅 无常的你 
希望你能理解 另一个我

31349327.review:
[h1]One, nothing wrong with me[/h1]
Higurashi is a top 30 VN spread across eight books. Most of them begin with a carefree slice of life high school scenario that eventually shifts into a sadistic, terrifying murder mystery. I'll review the series as a whole here. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=912786807&fileuploadsuccess=1
[b]Plot[/b]
There's over 50 hours of plot twists and reading to swallow, peppered with mystery staggered across the first four books and answers trickling slowly in the latter four. The story by itself is so brilliant that it spawned an anime, manga, and several subsequent adaptations. I was so compelled that I ended up reading for 11 days straight. 

[b]Visual[/b]
The hilariously bad character art has been redrawn and updated specifically for this release. While the new art is excellent, many of the backgrounds and still images didn't get transferred over from the recent PS3 release. Luckily you can mod most of the content back in, but if you go in unaware then you'll be missing out. Check out the steam guides to fix these shortcomings. 

[b]Sound[/b]
It almost hurts to not give this category a higher score. When the sound was ported the audio mixer failed to accommodate for capping the volume, so certain songs will nauseatingly pop and crack. Luckily the sound (like the art) can be modified and you can port in proper music or even the recreated tracks released from other editions. 

[b]Difficulty[/b]
Not a conventional game--not conventionally difficult. The challenge is in figuring out the answers and making predictions. It's almost spitefully impossible to crack the mystery during the first four books. 

[b]Spectacle[/b]
Mind crushingly terrifying. The slice of life bits give you a break and acclimate you to normalcy. Then everything gets shattered like this.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=906851423

[b]Gameplay[/b]
No decisions, no routes, just lean back in your chair or lie in bed while you click away.

[b]Four and a half stars out of five[/b]
Needing to mod the game to patch the sound quality and insert lost art assets keeps this game from getting a full five stars. Otherwise you have a fantastic thriller mystery that pushes the envelope with its gratuitous ultraviolence and paranoid suspense.

31163965.review:
[b]Please do not lament, I will forgive you even if the world will not forgive you.
Please do not lament, I will forgive you even if you will not forgive the world.
So please tell me; what will it take for you to forgive me? - Frederica Bernkastel[/b]

Here is the first chapter to the critically acclaimed [i]Higurashi When They Cry[/i] series: [i]Ch.1 - Onikakushi[/i]. The term onikakushi means "spirited away" or literally "taken away by demons". Starting with this first game, Higurashi series are known to be the best examples of horror/mystery thriller in Visual Novel genre with extensive use of sound effects, high quality horror narrative and well elaborated story revelation. I've had my eyes on this VN series for a while now, hearing high praises and exclamations of disbelief, like "I can't believe you haven't play that one yet. It is really creepy!". Completing this prologue, I can see why. This is by far, the best thriller narrative that I've come across in this genre.

Here we are taking the role of Keiichi Maebara, a young boy who just moved into silent village of Hinamizawa, far away from any big city. With its natural beauty and eerie isolation, Hinamizawa is the perfect setting of any Stephen King novel already. But Keiichi's life here starts funny, light hearted and perfectly amusing. He befriends a band of cheerful young girls, all with quirky characters and joins their gaming club. They keep each other company and go through many heartwarming experiences. Well, this is the first part of the game, presenting a feel of the core setting and most of the characters involved anyhow. Taking a closer look, this warm setting sits upon a gruesome mystery which Keiichi accidentally comes into contact with. Through sheer coincidence, he learns that there has been a violent murder within the village following an issue with a dam building project. Whenever he tries to ask his friends about the issue, they gleefully change the subject and pretend that there has never been anything suspicious within the town. After the annual Watanagashi festival, celebrating the local god - Oyashiro-sama - things get a quick turn from heartwarming to ominous, and eventually to daunting and downright psychotically creepy in the end.

At the end of this first game, you'll be presented more questions rather than answers, so don't be discouraged. Higurashi series mainly consist of 8 core games - 4 question arcs, and 4 answer arcs. Starting with this one, all first four games intend to present you with mysteries concerning this silent village and many characters who inhabit the place. Next four will gradually reveal the answers to those mysteries. Speaking of answers, all question arcs are here on steam already and the 5th game - first answer arc - will soon be here on Steam too. So, brace yourselves! Higurashi is a long ride, and I am more than convinced that it's gonna be worthy of both the time and the budget you'll spare for.

The game is a kinetic visual novel, in which you won't be presented with any choice options. You'll go ahead and witness a story - and a well written one at that too. For this specific series, the term "sound novel" is used though, even though there isn't any voiceover. The reason for the term is that the atmosphere within the series heavily relies on background music and various sound effects, starting with the trademark sound of higurashi - the evening cicada - dominating the village with their ominous, monotonous buzzing throughout the series. The written narrative is exceedingly good, with top-notch translation, presenting a grasping atmosphere whether it be lazy, competitive, thrilling or... deadly.

Again, I must note that the starting mood of the game shouldn't fool you. This is NOT a family friendly story, especially after its first half. At the end of each chapter, you'll reveal some hints concerning the true nature of events and as you complete the story, you'll be presented with a "all-cast" commentary about the events. Will they reveal anything? Nope, but they'll steer you towards the most probable path. This is a long running mystery with seriously well-arranged interrelation.

In this Steam version, all character artworks are updated, and presented as a bit more esthetic spirits compared to their original, cutesy versions. Yet, visuals are not the primary quality of the game. Both narrative and background sounds will engulf you into this uncanny mystery faster than any visual presentation.

May I recommend this first chapter? Without skipping a heartbeat. It is elaborate, it is relatable, it is mysterious and it is downright gruesome with a grasping narrative. What else I can ask for in this genre? Well, now that I'm done with this one, I'll proceed to play the second chapter. I am already curious about the fate of our characters and the proper way to answer all mysteries revolving around them. Good day and good gaming to you!

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

30904440.review:
I have been a huge fan of the "When They Cry" series (both Seagulls and Cicadas) for about three years short of a decade. I have, as most fans have, watched the series, read the manga and listened to the dramas...and I finally throw myself into the visual novels.N-Not because i was too cheap to buy them earlier or anything!
The updated sprites are wonderful! It's cool Rena's speech tick was included (as i've seen too many fan translations omit it)

There is...ONE THING i do NOT forgive: the goddamn text boxes. 
Yes, visual novel promotes the idea of imagery on a story. But visual novels have the power to immerse you into the story even more. A traditional text box would have allowed multiple sprite actions to happen during the text transition. 

Basically the sprite is set to change before or after a text box appears as a transition...meaning the displayed emotion goes along with what is said before or after the character is said to express it.
It kind of breaks it for me. A traditional text box would allow stacking actions, meaning rather than "chara:neutral > transition > chara:angry > text" you could have the character in a neutral state, and when you go to the next line of text, it simultaneously triggers the sprite changing along with the text.

idk. maybe im just a baby.

anyway 10/10 would let frederika bernkastel step on me

30888202.review:
First ,this game I rate a 10 out of 10 ,feel free to buy! Next I will talk about it...
The story happens around the holiday Watanagase, where for 4 years in a row for every holiday find one brutally murdered man, and the second is missing.
1983 (58th year of Showa era), in the village of Hinamizawa moved Keiichi Maebara. He quickly integrated into the friendly team of school club. But, suddenly, he begins to reveal the mystery that is full of not only the village itself, but almost every resident.
4 years ago the Japanese government created a project for the construction of a dam near the village. But the village was in a zone of prospective flooding. All the villagers offered a reward in exchange for their departure.
Three of the oldest and most respected families decided to leave the village, no one will, and founded a series of protest rallies. Almost the whole village was on the side of the three families. But there were opponents who were satisfied with a cash fee and they called for an exit from the village. At the head of the last movement were the parents of Satoko.
Some time later, committed the murder of the superintendent. Police found a dismembered corpse. For four years, the killer was never found. Since then, every holiday Watanagashi one person missing and another is found dead.
4 years later one of the mug must be subjected to the aggravation of the syndrome Hinamizawa and kills all the others. And at the very end at the altar dies, Furude Rick and history repeats itself.
Local God — Oyashiro-she appears as the protector of the village. For example, in the case of Renai, who left the village for a year, lost his mind because of the hallucinations and, armed with a bat, smashed all the Windows in her new school and beat several people. To punish the girl did not, but she soon returned to the village. Just the year before transfer Keiichi.
It is believed that the priestess of the temple of Furude (the title is passed from priestess to priestess) keeps people Syndrome Hinamizawa, until, while alive and resident is close to Ricky.
All the characters of the series are karmically linked. The theme of reincarnation and responsibility for what is happening reflects the mentality of the Japanese and allows us to understand their psychology different from the psychology of European mentality, formed a Christian culture. The portrayal of the characters is extremely simple, and the plot moves typical of a Thriller, but overall, it was a work that raises philosophical questions and color with deep psychology.

30872992.review:
[u]Норман Эллисон[/u]: [i]Мне страшно![/i]
[u]Дон Кольер[/u]: [i]Мне тоже страшно...[/i]  ([b]"Fury"[/b])

Как создать популярный визуальный роман, не обладая бюджетом, талантом и опытом? Идут годы, а гайдзинские рёнаи по-прежнему выглядят убогими пародиями на восточный игровой жанр и едва грезят об экранизации. Пока такие "титаны с мировым именем", как [b]Hanako Games[/b], [b]Love in Space[/b], [b]Winged Cloud[/b] и [b]Zeiva Inc[/b] теряются в догадках, а всякие [b]InvertMouse[/b], [b]Locomotivah[/b] и [b]Vysoko Anime Production[/b] безуспешно культивируют миф о независимой и самобытной гайдзинской новелле, в Японии додзинси-игры не только пользуются бешеной популярностью, но ещё и успешно экранизируются. Банальная случайность или аксиоматическая закономерность?

[u][b]Village of the Damned Children[/b][/u]
Ни для кого не секрет, что рёнай [url=en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryukishi07][b]Ryukishi07[/b][/url] давно превратился из коммерчески успешной фанатской игры в чрезвычайно популярную [url=www.world-art.ru/animation/animation_connection.php?id=5076]франшизу[/url], включающую манги, мультсериалы и полнометражные фильмы. Недавно вышедшая [url=www.imdb.com/title/tt5757082/]дорама[/url] и около пятидесяти тысяч проданных копий [url=store.steampowered.com/bundle/709/]четырёхглавого ремейка[/url] в [b]Steam[/b] - лишнее тому подтверждение. Тем сильнее удивляет, что феноменальная популярность отнюдь не игровая заслуга.

Допускаю, что обработанные фотографии вместо фона и примитивные спрайты персонажей могут быть как авторским почерком, так и экономико-техническими ограничениями 2002 года. Тем паче, они частично нивелируются обновлёнными спрайтами и хорошей атмосферной музыкой (нет, это, конечно, не [url=ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Каваи,_Кэндзи]Кэндзи Каваи[/url], но всё же), которую не грех и послушать отдельно, благо она находится в [i]Steam\steamapps\common\Higurashi When They Cry\HigurashiEp01_Data\StreamingAssets\BGM[/i].

Честно говоря, даже отсутствие выбора (привет, [url=androidconnect.ru/kikokugai-the-cyber-slayer-2/]"鬼哭街 -The Cyber Slayer-"[/url]) не стало для вашего покорного слуги отправной точкой к резкому падению интереса. Конечно, это нельзя расценить однозначно, но к "кинетичности" ещё можно отнестись по-философски... Чего, увы, не скажешь о тоннах графомании.

И самое обидное, что история начинается с бодрого пролога, который подхватывает нужное настроение, не омрачаемое [url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=478592411]фанатским переводом[/url]. На первый взгляд, приезд [i]Кейти[/i] в японскую деревню [i]Хинамидзаву[/i] и знакомство с её обычаями и обитателями вызывают неподдельный интерес и первые полчаса-час проходят непринуждённо и даже забавно. Милая [i]Рэна[/i], озорная [i]Сатоко[/i], хитрая и смелая [i]Мион[/i] и сердечная [i]Рика[/i] невольно заражают симпатией, несмотря на очевидное смещение акцента от триллера к "школьному гарему". Впрочем, первая встреча с [i]Томитакэ[/i] и анализ документов живо разжигают интерес к делу о жестоком убийстве...

Но на следующий игровой день саспенс бесследно исчезает, оставляя читателя с носом, ибо целевая аудитория нашего фаната [url=store.steampowered.com/app/382890/]"Final Fantasy V"[/url] - помешанные на сексе, несовершеннолетних и школьной романтике отаку, которые никогда не смотрели [url=www.imdb.com/title/tt0098936/]"Твин Пикс"[/url] и не читали [url=ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Кинг,_Стивен]С. Э. Кинга[/url]. Пока саспенс даётся по чайной ложечке на главу, неоднократно возникает справедливое желание выплюнуть жвачку для мозгов и запустить вместо неё старую добрую [url=store.steampowered.com/app/251270/]"Corpse Party"[/url]...

К счастью, во второй половине рёная, до которой правдами и неправдами добралась лишь пятая часть от общего числа игроков, графомания уступит место чернухе, крепко сбитому триллеру и не отпустит усидчивого читателя до рокового финала. Будучи неофитом, мне было весьма приятно увидеть самые яркие эпизоды "из первых рук". Разумеется, это не [url=mangaclub.ru/439-the-spiral.html]"Uzumaki"[/url], на мой вкус лучшая хоррор-манга, но музыка, спрайты и параноидальная атмосфера не оставляют сомнений в том, что... мы переживём это ещё не раз в последующих главах, словно заправские буддисты. Разумеется, для фанатов аниме-сериала это не новость, но там большая часть глав уместилась в [url=yummyanime.com/catalog/item/kogda-plachut-cikady-tv-1]26-серийный сезон[/url].

Сердитое качество ремейка тоже не вызывает желания провести день Сурка в океане сансары. Ведь помимо "[i]BRAND NEW CHARACTER ART[/i]" похвастаться-то ему и нечем - ни опенинга, ни мини-игры, ни анимации, ни озвучки¹, - в ортодоксальной PC-версии всё так же аскетично, как и 12 лет назад. Иными словами, [b]MangaGamer[/b] издала музейный экспонат в практически первозданном виде. Как отдельная мистическая история он стоит своих денег на распродаже, но как первая глава цельного произведения навряд ли.

[u][b]Всё, что ты любил когда-то, ветром унесёт[/b][/u]
Незнакомые с оригиналом могут смело накидывать к итоговой оценке 5%, фанаты аниме - все 10%. Как ни прискорбно, а в наши дни игра из первоисточника превратилась в интригующее, но необязательное дополнение к первому сезону сериала и время её отнюдь не пощадило. Звезда исчезла с небосклона, оставив после себя лишь яркий след: мимолётный всплеск случайной славы, трепетно хранящийся в фанатских сердцах.

¹ Впрочем, народные умельцы [url=steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=472162724]добавили озвучку и консольные спрайты[/url].

30340039.review:
Well, that was . . . uncomfortable? Disturbing? Chilling? Unnerving? All of the above, I suppose.

Onikakushi is but the first of many in the Higurashi series of VNs. The characters themselves refer to it as a "prologue" (in an extra, cast-party type story), and this may very well be.  That said, the story feels "complete" in that it does in fact have an ending.  And ending with no shortage of questions and WTF? moments, but an ending none-the-less.

Self-described as a "sound novel", I was at first taken aback by that term considering there is no voice acting.  But, as the story develops further, the use of music and especially sound effects can be intense.  This is one of the few VNs I've read where a subtle shift in the sound that the cicadas make would cause my hair to stand on end in anticipation.  So in that regard, I do believe it's significantly different from many of the VNs I've gone through before.

Oh, and bonus points for making me look up the word "gelid". I have to say, I'm pretty sure that's the first time I've ever seen it used in a video game.

well, personally i enjoyed the anime better. maybe i should have played these games first and then watch the anime. after watching the anime this game feels very slow, but the story is still great. don't play just one chapter, play them all! the ending won't be something you would've expected.

30189985.review:
First off, you will definitely get your money's worth from this game. 
It actually did take me about ten hours to beat and that was with me clicking fast (although, granted, you can completely fast-forward the whole story to get the achievements but that is very unsportsman-like and I don't condone it).

Secondly, the beginning is very cute but then it starts getting annoying because you just want to see the cool stuff but you're stuck playing games with your friends or whatever and I do reccomend fast-forwarding that because your relationship with these people has already been established and you don't need to be slogging through more bullshit. You need to get to the meat because the story is just so damn good.

Thirdly, it's heart-breaking. The beginning is so light-hearted and then it really takes a dark turn. I was legitimately scared at moments and it felt like I was playing a horror game because I was breathing heavy. You and the main character are always questioning and wondering and the ending leaves you hungry for more.

So please remember, this is the first part of a four(?)-part story. There is more to come in the mysterious town of Hinamizawa and I recommend playing another chapter if you truly wish to see the end.

30050994.review:
Higurashi Whey They Cry Hou-Ch. 1 Onikakushi is a visual novel where you take on the role Keiichi Maebara, a student who has recently moved from the city to the small village of Hinamizawa.  Specifically, it's a kinetic novel, which means that there are no choices to be made; you simply progress for the story itself.  It takes place in the early summer of 1983, and we are introduced to Hinamizawa and its inhabitants through Keiichi's eyes.  Specifically, the characters who make the most appearance time are four of his classmates (Rena, Mion, Satoko, Rika) as well as Tomitake, a freelance photographer, and Ooishi, a detective from a neighboring town.  Keiichi goes about his life, getting acquainted with Hinamizawa and developing friendships with the four girls, and everything seems to be the normal, mundane life until a tragic event takes place and Keiichi starts learning about certain incidents that have happened surrounding Hinamizawa.  He's pulled into this world that he wished that he had stayed ignorant of but it's too late to go back to being ignorant.  As there are four chapters (question arcs) in the series, this first chapter is known as the prologue and focuses on the introduction of Hinamizawa and as you may have guessed, there are specific scenes between Keiichi and Rena.  I believe that the following chapters will focus on other aspects of the story and Keiichi's relationships with the other girls although I have yet to play them.

As this is a kinetic novel, though, I won't say anything more about it, not wanting to spoil the story.  I will say that, especially in the latter half, there are more horror elements so one should be prepared for that.  As you progress through the story, after each chapter, new tips will be unlocked and reading them will give you more insight as to what's going on (not simply learning about events from Keiichi's point of view).  Also, after you finish Ch.1 in its entirety, you have the option to replay certain days' events as well as a fun after party for the cast in which the characters give their ideas and theories as to what's going on.  These are all unlocked in the Extras section on the main menu that is unlocked after you finish one day in the game (as that's how the game is divided-by days).

As to my opinion of ch. 1, I totally loved the story.  I felt myself getting drawn in, especially towards the latter half when things start getting crazy.  (I wish I could be more specific but that would be spoiling the story.)  I loved the characters-Rena, the shy, sweet girl; Mion, the tomboy leader; Satoko, the prankster; Rika, the quiet, wise, composed one.  Things are definitely not what they seem and after finishing ch. 1, there isn't an answer as to what happened.  You can only make guesses but I understand that there are chapters called answer arcs that will eventually address these questions.  The story was really well written, the art (newer style) was great, and I loved the music.  The pieces fit in well with specific events and I totally felt creeped out when there were the scary parts.

Overall, I totally loved Higurashi Whey They Cry Hou-Ch. 1 Onikakushi and I'm happy that I got the chance to play it.  I'm really looking forward to Ch. 2 and learning more about what's going on in that world.  ^^

29124293.review:
This visual novel has that issue a lot of sophomoric writing has where it's just too damn impressed with itself. Perhaps it's partially the fault of the translation, but the writing fails on some basic levels. There's tons of tell rather than show, which is especially bad when you have the support of backgrounds and character expressions.

I couldn't even finish this first episode. It's amateurish and unpleasant.

[h1]Um visual novel rico em história[/h1]

Higurashi When They Cry (em japonês/no anime : Higurashi no Naku koro Ni) é um visual novel que conta a história de Keiichi que se muda para uma cidade ás montanhas e tem uma amiga chamada Rena , um pouco estranha , digamos . Eu ainda não finalizei o jogo , então não sei muito da história , apenas isso .

A jogabilidade é muito fácil e de qualquer visual novel : Clicar com o botão do mouse para passar as falas e saber sobre a história . É muito simples . Então o jogo apenas se resume em personagens e história .

Personagens : 10/10 

História : 10/10 

Jogabilidade : Darei um 7/10 pois eu gostaria muito que Higurashi fosse um RPG , seria esplêndido! Mas como não é , lhe darei um sete , pois a jogabilidade me deixou meio cansada .

28209961.review:
Higurashi is a fantastic horror visual novel. The writing and sound design, as well as separation into several parts, make it a great option for getting into the genre. While the story is also available as a manga or anime, the visual novel version allows for a more gradual, suspense-filled build up than the other two formats allow. 

The art, even with redrawn sprites, still leaves much to be desired, and the pacing feels off at times. Nonetheless, I found myself in genuine fear and dread during the more successful parts of the first chapter, despite having seen the anime depiction of the same events. The characters are all likeable, and the chapter is short enough that I didn't become uninterested or uncaring, even in the less engaging parts. My biggest complaint is that the exposition features about four instances of the main characters playing board games or other type of game, and these scenes feel far too drawn out. 

Not a perfect game by any means, but at $6, this is a great chance to see if you're interested in the Higurashi series or the genre in general.
