I had absolutely no exposure to this series prior to playing Onikakushi, but what I found here was enough to dig into pretty much everything I could find that had 'Higurashi' attached to it. It ranks up there for me alongside Evangelion, Steins;Gate, and Cowboy Bebop as some of the best work i've ever seen come out of Japan.

20417105.review:
This game is great for those looking for a light-hearted VN romp to pass the time. The story is set in the small town of Hinamizawa, focusing mostly on the local school and its students. 
The plot revolves around Maebara Keichi, the only male in his small group of friends, at least half of which have crushes on him. Over the course of this and subsequent chapters, Keichi and co. become involved in all sorts of typical hijinks, while learning more about friendship and the importance of trust. This formula is taken for a slight curve-ball near the end, as they have to take down a cartoonishly evil villain with the help of a character whome I can only assume is based off the main character in Home Alone. 
As a typical slice-of-life story, this is a perfectly adequate entry into the genre. My only complaints would be that the romance options don't really go anywhere, and the odd shifts in tone when the story detours into what I assume to be dream sequences. Despite this, I found this to be quite enjoyable to wind down with at the end of the day.
9/10

20408022.review:
I have yet to watch the anime for this series. In fact, this is my first time experiencing the Higurashi series, except for a few short clips that I've seen from the anime. I recently got into reading visual novels (even though this one refers to itself as a "sound novel". Even so, I'm pretty sure it counts as a visual novel), and I can say, they won't appeal to everyone, since many just want to play a game that's a game, and a book that's a book. However, I never took that much enjoyment in reading actual novels (I find it hard to pay attention while reading, usually), so a visual novel appeals more to me, since I'm required to click, which helps keep my attention. 

The first 3-5 hours or so features little story, and mainly focuses on anime tropes. I personally didn't mind this section too much, since it got me to know the characters better. However, I can see how someone would take little enjoyment in this section of the "game". 

The second half of the visual novel is where the story really gets started. I thought that this section was done very well.  I found myself surprised at how uncomfortable I could feel from mostly words, sounds, and also a few pictures. The atmosphere in this visual novel is done quite well in my opinion. I felt immersed in the village of Hinamizawa, even though all I had to do was click and read. 

As soon as I was reaching near the end of this chapter, I knew that I wanted to read the next. Originally, I thought I would just go on to watch the anime, but now, I'm very curious to read more of the visual novel. 

Overall, I highly recommend buying this "game" if you are alright with just clicking and reading. If you are ok with that, get ready to be spooked m8.

20389484.review:
This is a tricky game to review simply because as much as I loved my time with it while playing, I feel somewhat cheated now that I've finished it. The game refers to itself as a prologue and there is too much left unknown by the end that I don't really feel like I have any sense of closure.  

With only two parts of the eight parts translated and on STEAM at this time, I'm not sure it would be wise for those on the fence to jump on this now.  I might suggest waiting until more have been released and then trying the game when you can either get a bundle or the first couple on sale.

The art itself is great, the characters really likeable and interesting and the mystery is an interesting one, but I'm not sure the game knows what genre it wants to be.  The first 2/3's or so is an enjoyable slice of life Visual Novel with the last portion acting as a thriller.  I state thriller here because I went in expecting horror, but it really wasn't as scary as I had hoped or expected (and I'm not exactly the bravest when it comes to horror games).  

One final piece is that the game isn't really a game in that it does not allow any interactions aside from advanced text and watching some mildly interesting extra scenes called "TIPS", so bare that in mind if you prefer something a little more active.  Even with all this said, I really enjoyed this Visual Novel and would recommend, but the recommendation is a lot more tepid once I've reached the "end" of this game.

20262553.review:
Higurashi Onikakushi chapter may not have a long story, but it does have an interesting one that you'll want to finish. It is a horror/mystery, so there are dark themes in this game - YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

[h1]STORY:[/h1] - [b]May be Spoilers! - again, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED[/b]
The story has a slow start (kind of) but definitely speeds up before the halfway mark.
It focuses on Keiichi Maebara, a 16-year old student who has moved to the rural village of Hinamizawa with his parents due to his father's work as an artist. After living there for about a month, Keiichi has gotten used to the life there with his new friends: Rena Ryuugu, Mion Sonozaki, Satoko Houjou, and Rika Furude. While everything appears normal with the village at first, Keiichi learns from a visiting photographer, Tomitake, about some mysterious murders which occur each year. What makes it even stranger is that Rena and Mion, when asked about it, deny the existance of them. Days pass and the anual Cotton Drifting (Watanagashi) festival approaches, and Keiichi finds out from Tomitake and and a friend of his that the murders are supposedly tied to a curse from the village's god, Oyashiro-sama.

Following the festival, Keiichi is visited by a police detective, Ooishi, who alerts to him about [spoiler]the death of Tomitake, and the disappearance of his friend[/spoiler]. Keiichi is told that this is a result of the curse, and is warned by Ooishi that he could be next. Although skeptical at first, Keiichi begins to become paranoid about his surroundings, and begins to become suspicious of Rena and Mion, who begin acting strangely. 
What will happen to Keiichi? Are Rena and Mion up to something? Is the curse real? Will I stop asking all these questions? Find out the answer to all of them (except the last one) in this chapter!

[h1]ART AND SOUND:[/h1]
It is worth mentioning that all the character sprites that appear in the game have been redesigned by MangaGamer, however you can switch between the original and new sprites if you wish. The sprites from the Playstation versions can be used through use of mods, although I personally don't see anything wrong with botht he old and new sprites. All of the backgrounds and music remain the same as the original, and that I find is good, as it helps preserve the feel that the sound novel is supposed to give. 

One part I am disappointed with is that there are no CG images used, unlike most visual novels. Some parts of the game would be better with CG images in my opinion, and it confuses me as to why MangaGamer didn't include any, considering they went through the effort to redesign the character models. If you wish to view CG images, I believe there is a patch that adds in the ones from the Playstation versions, although the game is still good without them.

[h1]OTHER NOTES:[/h1]
The story takes roughly 10 hours or so to finish, which is short compared to many visual novels. This is due to that this is only chapter 1 of the game. For the complete story, there are 8 chapters, 4 question arcs and 4 answer arcs. At the time of writing this review, only the first two chapters are released (Onikakushi and Watanagashi), with chapter 3 currently being translated. More games are on their way, although they don't affect the main story.

[h1]RATING:[/h1] Buy and Play. 9.5/10

19930833.review:
I'm awful at doing in depth reviews, so I'll give some of my quick thoughts.

I've was introduced to Higurashi through the anime.  While the anime was an amazing adaptation of an intricate story, the source material still stands head and shoulders above.  All of the characters are more fleshed out, and given more attention.  There are jokes and club activity scenes that didn't make it into the anime at all.  The story and backstory of Hinamizawa is given way more detail.

If you've seen the show, or have read the VNs before, on reread, you'll notice so many hints and minor details that clue in at what's actually going on, and it's really satisfying.

If you're completely new to the series, you'll probably be confused about what's actually going on by the end of the game, but let me assure you that Higurashi is one of the few works I've seen where absolutely every loose-end is tied up by the end of the adventure.  

The translation is really good, way better than the original localization MG put out years ago, and I'm glad they redid it.  The new sprites are also really pretty, and I actually prefer them to the PS3 versions.  The photo-filtered backgrounds don't bug me, but from what I understand, it's easy enough to patch in the PS3 backgrounds with a little googling. 

When I first saw that MangaGamer was going to charge $5-10 per part, I was a little skeptical, but since picking up and playing parts 1 and 2, I'm eager to throw my money at them for the rest.

19719252.review:
A masterpiece amongst visual novels.

I've never been a fan of the horror genre, but Higurashi is an exception. Higurashi is different because it doesn't take "generic" horror cliches such as extreme amounts of gore or jump scares. If you've watched the anime or played the VN already, yes, I agree, it does take a while to get to the scary parts. But the build-up and the contrast makes it worth it. If you went into this game blind without even reading the description, you might even start to think it's just another romance visual novel. The lightheartedness of the beginning contrasting with the slowly ascending terror makes reading and continuing addicting. 

I played the game with the voice patch installed. However, Higurashi is by origin a sound novel, where just the sounds alone are capable of giving you a great experience. But do yourself a favor and install that voice patch anyway. The voices help bring the characters to life, and it helps set the mood with the cute to evil switches.

If you've never experienced Higurashi When They Cry before, you're in for a ride. One playthrough won't be able to satisfy all the countless questions going through your head after the ending. Read it again and live in the world of Hinamizawa again, and try to figure out the mystery yourself and where things went wrong. Before you know it, you'll finish the game at 3 am, and not sleep until 11 am in fear of Rena waiting at your door.

19667304.review:
Higurashi When They Cry (Higurashi no Naku Koro ni  o Cuando las cigarras cantan) es una novela visual producida por 07th Expansion, lanzada por primera vez el 10 de agosto de 2002.

Los primeros cuatro capítulos de esta novela reciben el nombre de Higurashi no Naku Koro ni (arco de preguntas), mientras que los restantes tienen el título de Higurashi no Naku Koro ni Kai (arco de respuestas).

Ésta novela visual es más bien definida como "Sound Novel" (Novela Sonora), ya que posee las caraterísticas de una 
novela visual, aunque en este caso, se destaca la banda sonora creando una gran atmósfera en el juego.

Higurashi no Naku Koro ni ha recibido adaptaciones al anime (dos temporadas y varias ovas), manga, novelas ligeras y un Live action.

[h1]UN DATO INTERESANTE:[/h1]

A diferencia de las novelas visuales realizadas por compañías, 07th Expansion no creó la música de los juegos. La música de las sagas de preguntas son canciones libres encontradas en Internet, mientras que la música de las sagas de respuestas fueron recibidas por parte de fans que habían realizado un dōjin.

[h1]Opinión personal:[/h1]

Higurashi When They Cry es una novela que definitivamente tienes que leer. Posee una mezcla de momentos divertidos, momentos de tensión, de misterio y de terror.

[h1]Historia[/h1]

De lo mejor. Hay variedad de personajes muy buenos. La historia tiene muchos detalles, lo cual me ha gustado. El misterio es exelente y este capítulo al igual que los próximos tres, nos irán creando más y más dudas.

[h1]Sonido[/h1]

Su banda sonora es increíble, simplemente exelente. He disfrutado mucho leyendo con la música de este juego.
El punto malo de esto es que no tenga voces como la versión de PS2 o PS3 ( no culpo a MangaGamer, porque licenciarlas es algo muy costoso).

[h1]Gráficos[/h1]

Sus "sprites" (es decir el diseño de personajes) son muy buenos. MangaGamer mantuvo los backgrounds (fondos) de la versión original, lo cual a mi no me gustó mucho. Hubiera preferido los fondos de la versión de PS3.

[h1]Conclusión[/h1]

Si eres fan de Higurashi y/o no has jugado esta novela, te la recomiendo al 100%. Pasarás un gran momento, y disfrutarás de una historia única.

[h1]PD: el juego me tomó aproximadamente 21 horas en terminarlo (jugué el capítulo, el after party y todos los tips).
Lo he jugado con voces y fondos de la versión de PS3, y los sprites de esta versión.[/h1]

An excellent prologue to a fantastic series.

I'm a fan of the anime adaptation and have watched all 2 seasons. I can still recall major plot twists and background stories. I thought I knew what was in store when I started the visual novel, but the 2nd half of the VN blew my mind. 
The 1st half is a very slow opening with cheesy background music. The creators must have a huge obsession with card games because there are so many of them! None but one of the card games have impact on the story ... at least not in the first chapter.
The 2nd half, on ther hand, is brilliant. Careful manipulations of background music, sound effects and images live up to the reputation of the entire series.

Worth the full price.

19517023.review:
[!] This is my first review and its my first VN as well, so please take it easy.

I'm new to the Higurashi series and i've not heard of it from reading manga nor do i watch it from anime before, yet this visual novel is fun to read. (In fact, its the first visual novel i've read in my life as well. Don't ask me why.)

[contains minor spoiler]
It's full of twisted horror which is far more gruesome than keiichi getting punished after a card game. The story at first, like everyone said, is just a flow until the day of the festival. From there, the main characters starts to feel suspicious and things start to fall apart as Keiichi attempts to find the truth behind the dam incident.

As he learns the mystery, the incident somehow points toward his friends who might be involved with the incident. Learning about their background, the story changes from a friendly atmosphere into a nightmare. So much so that Keiichi knew that he will endanger himself for knowing too much about the truth.

Expect the unexpected things, i've tried to predict what is going to happen next, yet the outcome is always unexpected especially towards the end. You will end up asking yourself: What is the main cause of the entire tragedy? Is the curse to be blame or is it's someone behind all this. You'll never know even if you finish reading the first chapter. You'll definitely want to get the next chapter if you want to know more about it. Btw, Rena is scarier although she is very kyute. 

[Overall]
What a read! I'm glad i purchased both chapters from the recent Autumn sale, i've already finished reading the first chapter and i definitely going to read the next. Despite the fact that this is just only a prologue, it's pretty much scarier than you can think and always give you a creep when you head for bed. That being said, you don't have to watch the anime in order to love it. I can easily recommend this to anyone who loves horror and tragedy. I dare you to try to read everything and play some scary music at the background as you hit the climax of the story.

----- Tips -----
If you heard that the steam version of this visual novel doesn't have charactor sounds , yea , but the steam community has already provided PS3 Sound files in the Community Hub. After installing , I finally get to listen to familiar charactor sounds from the anime.
----- Warning ! Spoilers below -----
Higurashi When They Cry - Ch.1 Onikakushi is a special kind of Horror Visual Novel. Finally got to play this game after watching the anime version which was released in 2003.
Like what the anime version provides , at first you can only feel comfort , relaxed and giggling through the scenes of encounters. However, when you start to discover more strange things and went into the long-lasting deep dark secret which is still on Hinamizawa, you will face a totally different feeling. Fear. Feeling afarid from all other people, even the one who can understands you. You try your best to go through life-endangering events, but at last you will face yours or the other's final moment. As the one you beloved tries to kill you , you realized that your own destiny is set already when you moved into this town.
In the anime version of this chapter, Keiichi killed Rena and Mion with a bat which was owned by Satoko's brother. Then , he got affected by the "power" ( later mentioned as ghost power , alien-power or alien virus ) and killed his own self when he tries to tell the old policeman ( which visited their school for multiple times ) about the secret of Hinamizawa through a public phone.

19382002.review:
(( Hey all,

Well, I wasn't sure what to expect from "Higurashi: When They Cry, Chapter 1", but I saw it was on sale, and figured I would give it a shot.  And now that it's over... it's... freak-a-ly amazing!  I can't really say anything, without spoiling the story, but it is well worth the price of admission.  

The story is solid blend of daily-life, mystery, suspense, murder, horror, macabre, legends, myths, and ghost tales.  While it takes a spot to get used to how the characters "talk"(since it isn't voiced), the translation is very well done, and helps give the cast their own, unique personalities.  Chapter 1 focuses mostly on the interaction of three members of the cast, and my understanding is later chapters flesh out the rest of the townsfolk of Hinamizawa.  Music and sound effects are blended into the show to help with the immersion of the story.  I enjoyed the updated graphics more than the original character sprites; however, both do have their own charm.

Overall, well worth checking out. ))

I picked this up in one of the IndieGala bundles a few months ago.
This was the 3rd visual novel I ever played (after Snatcher and Radical Dreamers), and the first where I knew nothing about the story going into it.

I felt the story was really slow to get going, almost as if it was deliberately playing off the crappy stereotypes visual novels have. But, as other people have mentioned, it really picked up once the festival began and the game showed its true colours, with some genuinely frightening moments.

The game ended with plenty to ponder before the next episode. I am interested to see where the story goes from here and will pick up Ch. 2 - Watanagashi at some stage.

The only problem is that €6 is too expensive for what the game offers, especially since 14 chapters are planned for release individually. The game is a kinetic novel, offering no choices to the player, which really limits its replayability.

I would recommend reading this, but only if you get it on sale.

19190965.review: While higurashi is a stand alone game, trying to compare it to any other visual novel on steam doesn't really do it any justice. The game that comes closest to it would be the zero escape series with 999 and Virtue's Last Reward. Instead of there being alternate branching timelines within a singular game pulling all the plot strings together, it is spread out between the singular episodes of Higurashi. While each game tells it's own story, it is only when you peice everything together as an outside observer that it will fall into place and become a masterpeice. If you're a fan of either series, I highly reccomend picking this up even if you have seen the anime (it does it no justice) and be prepared to be in it for the long haul.

19122799.review:
通关：寒蝉鸣泣之时第一章：鬼隐篇。顺便说下，现在第二章：绵流篇已经出了。全成就，心情沉重。在这里特别提醒不了解本作的各位：这不是一款轻松向的文字恋爱游戏，它带给你的只有压抑、绷紧的神经、以及无尽的谜团。

去掉挂卡时间，本作的通关时间大概在15-20小时左右，当然并不绝对，还要取决于玩家的阅读和思考速度。而且对于这款游戏来说，并不是越快通关越好，因为它还包含了悬疑和推理要素。

本作没有互动，唯一能做的就是看着他们：死去或是发狂，是的，玩家【只能看着】。而且更可笑的是，因为是第一人称，玩家连真相都无法得知，因为并不客观和全面，还夹杂着大量不知道是不是主人公妄想的心理活动。玩家所以为的真相，也许不过是少年的想象而已，主观证据无法定罪，不是吗？

以下内容涉及剧透，请注意：
[spoiler]少年来自城市，由于父母工作原因搬到了一个小山村里，认识了四个女孩子：
1、超喜欢萌物（虽然萌的标准千奇百怪），很容易害羞，有的时候会打出破坏力十足的拳头的Rena；
2、经常自称“老年人”，偶尔会说荤段子，脑子里总是充满各种可怕的恶作剧的Mion；
3、喜欢弄出各种“陷阱”来针对男主，但其实只是表达幼稚友谊的Satoko；
4、看起来超级无害很会安慰人，但有时会说出一些可怕的话，平时总是一本正经但其实很腹黑的Rika。

最开始的时光真是美好，每天早上Rena来找少年，然后在上学路上遇到Mion，三个人一起去学校，路上打打闹闹。进门的时候要解决掉Satoko的“陷阱”，偶尔中招，还会得到Rika的“摸摸头，痛痛飞走”的安慰。在学校里，少年加入了四个女孩子的俱乐部，每天中午一起吃饭，放学后一起玩游戏。

少年以为自己已经融入了这个小山村，这样的日子将会一直持续下去，直到“那一天”。

那是村子里的节日，节日的晚上全村人都在外面狂欢，少年从东京来的摄影师那里得知了一个惊天秘密：每年，在这个节日的晚上，都有人死去，而今天，就是验证这个染血的传说是否会继续的日子。然后，摄影师死去了，以一种诡异的姿态：他用自己的指甲抓穿了自己的喉咙。而和他在一起的女人则失踪了，活不见人死不见尸。小镇上的警察找到了少年，希望他帮助自己，找到真相，因为他怀疑，整个事件，是村子的合谋，而少年，作为刚搬进来的“外人”，在村子已经没有敌人的今天，会成为下一年的牺牲者。

然后，少年的世界开始变化了：Rena和Mion，往日里最亲密的两个朋友，开始时不时的面目狰狞。村子里的人也开始亮出锋利的爪牙：陌生男人的袭击、突然撞过来的白色小货车。一切的一切，真的是他们所说的村子守护神的诅咒吗？还是人为导致的这一切惨剧？[/spoiler]

希望你，看到我写的字条的人，找出真相。这句话沉甸甸的，让我心情复杂。祝死者们安息，阿门。

19122175.review:
Just watch the anime or read the manga -_-

Okay anyways I'm something of a casual fan who's popped in and out of the mood for Higurashi goodness and found this incredibly misleading. "A VN Higurashi game" Steam said? Well I'll be damned, this sounds like the perfect idea for Higurashi. I bet I could make the right choices for a happy ending with Rena on my first run, I imagined.

But in truth it's really not a game but a literal visual novel, with no form of interaction, options, endings and so on. While the elite fanatics will argue with me (as if I mocked Jesus Christ himself) that VN's don't have to be games and that I should practically be ashamed of ever wanting a Higurashi game. Just calm your tits people, just because I don't like this approach doesn't mean I dislike the franchise.

Listening to the hardcore fans yell at me still makes my neck itch as I had at first asked about the game. Something simple like "Okay I've read over 2 hours of story, when do I get the options?" only to get talked down to by uppity folks like a condescending mother talking down a kid. "Choices? What do you think your playing? Higurashi has no 'options' only story! God, why do these casuals always think a VN is a game?" Oh I dunno...because most of them are? In anycase I was pretty screwed as I had hit the 2 hour marker and couldn't get a refund. however it wouldn't be lady like of me to complain about wasted money.

In anycase while the story is great, I just don't like how it's being delivered. If you're like me at all, you'd think given how it is, Higurashi could make for a really awesome Choice making game. Frankly I'd rather just buy the Manga or Anime. More expensive sure but I'll be more satisfied with those. But also from what I heard this version is still pretty out of date, probably cause of some of the hideous renditions or something, I wouldn't know.

I can't even give this a rating as it's not an actual game...but I still wouldn't recommend it unless you want to only read, you know, like a book. (Something else I just don't get...if you want to read, just buy a book. Don't know why people hate books/comics/manga/whatever so much...)

19114803.review:
Обожаю цикад, хотя к аниме тайтлам отношусь очень избирательно, так что мнение может быть слишком субъективным + имею небольшой опыт игры в визуальные новеллы/романы.
Про сюжет говорить много не стоит. Он прекрасен, по-своему уникален и оригинален, как правило оценивается высоко.
Несмотря на то, что ГГ - типичный ОЯШ, и его окружает разноцветный гарем, по сюжету игра никак не гаремник. У персонажей, главным образом девочек-подруг ГГ, колоритные не только волосы, но и характеры. Они очень выразительны, интересны, каждая имеет набор запоминающихся и подчёркивающих её привычек, без какой-либо из них не вяжется сюжет (общий). Вообще все персонажи благодаря особенностям повествования (общего) демонстрируются с разных сторон. Смесь свойств различных жанров, даже противоположных (комедия, ужасы, детектив, в какой-то мере нуар, мистика, [spoiler]научная фантастика[/spoiler] и др.), смешанных в блендере, получается очень "вкусной".
Что касается геймплея и особенностей технической стороны игры, то стоит помнить, что она вышла в [b]2002[/b] году (эта часть). [list][*]Это даже не визуальная новелла/роман, а читальная новелла/роман. Сюжет линейный: тут нет вилок и какого либо интерактива, вообще геймплея как такового - кликай и [strike]очумевай[/strike] читай. [*]Нет отдельного текстового бокса: он занимает весь экран, что мешает рассматривать картинку (экран с текстом всегда затемнён; есть команда по клавише [b]Пробел[/b], которая скрывает текст и затемнение). [*]Из визуализации тут только очень ограниченный набор "задников" (оригиналы - размытые, обработанные фотографии) и модели персонажей (основных, не наберётся и десятка). А из-за того, что описывается всё выложенными на экране мыслями ГГ довольно полно (даже чересчур обильно) и детально, то возникает определённый когнитивный диссонанс в связи с непропорциональностью визуальной и текстовой части. В этой игре понадобится богатая фантазия. Если вы недостаточно хорошо знаете язык, на котором играете, то это только усугубляет ситуацию. [*]В игре по стандарту нет озвучки ([u]в Стиме[/u]). Никакой; ни японской, ни английской, и уж тем более какой-то фандабовской русской (тут уж слава [strike]Оясиро-сама[/strike] богам). Но японская озвучка явно не помешала бы. [*]Вышеперечисленные геймплейные и технические недостатки могут быть исправлены благодаря несомненному плюсу игры - она неприхотлива к модификациям. Лично я поставил себе русскую локализацую (она временами достаточно кривая, пару раз мелькает код, 1 был мат, но главное - часто странное или неграмотное построение предложений или странная лексика, в том чесле диалектизмы, но их можно списать на нелепую попытку закосить под провинциальную речь) и японскую озвучку, а также другие фоны (всё это - из местных стимовских руководств). Играть стало комфортней и приятней. Игра ни разу не вылетала/крашилась.[/list]
Что касается того, как она переиздаётся в Стиме. Выходит 1 эпизод (одна игра) раз в несколько месяцев. В игре нет какого-либо тезауруса, галерей и т. д. Из дополнительного контента только 20 дополнительных сцен ("tips", тобишь советы, намёки, "улики").

[b]Итог[/b]: Великолепный самобытный сюжет и повествование, которые перекрывают недостатки наглядности, технические моменты и особенности издания.
[b]P.S.[/b]: Перед игрой обрежьте ногти на руках под корень, посмотрите [i]"Один дома"[/i] и поешьте. И советую начать бегать по утрам.

19103827.review:
Higurashi is a series of twisted twisted mystery novels that will likely each take multiple readings to figure out. Each arc leaves you with more questions than answers! Fortunately for dimmer bulbs such as myself, each novel has an optional epilogue where the characters summarize the events of the mystery for you. However, much like in the game you get the feeling that the characters are still gleefully tossing out red herrings to distract you from the real clues...

Normally I try to avoid the horror genre in any format, but I do love psychological thrillers, especially those with occult themes. What's more, this is a series that knows how to play with your emotions - you get to know the characters before everything starts to turn bad. Having read many other VNs, I can say that only one has ever managed to make my blood run cold quite like that moment in this game, Onikakushi, when everything starts to go wrong!

A fantastic VN, highly recommended.

18907843.review:
NOTE: Visual novel, no choices, just read. However, fantastic horror story.

-----------------------------------

I am Keiichi. 

I recently moved from the city to a village in the arse end of nowhere. It's a little boring, but I enjoy it. I met a few girls around here, who seem nice.

There is Rena, the sweetest girl you could ever meet. She meets me every day to give me food (best food by the way), beautiful and kind and caring. She blushes so quickly, and is easy to make blush with the most basic of compliments. If she ever sees something cute, well, watch out.

And Mion. Not really beautiful, but she is clever and competitive. Seriously, watch out. She is an expert in board games, and she will win at any cost. She is the de-facto leader, but she keeps things light and her sharp tongue keeps you on your feet.

And Satako and Rika, two little sweet girls with a love for pranks and patting my head.

I'm so lucky to meet them.

So why I am now sitting in my room, covered in blood, clutching a metal bat, learning I am not the first person to be hunted to death by a... a deamon or something or people....

I am afraid for my life.
I do not know why they want it.

Only the Cicada know.

18804662.review:
As someone who has heard a lot about this sound novel series and seen some of it's anime adaptation, I am so far loving this as much as any other game I have played (there are many). The story is set to a great pace, and they don't just dive into the horror aspects right off the bat, like some games. I recommend this game very much, but there are and will be some gripes in my review, and those are mostly with the backgrounds not being updated and the UI not getting a new look. The backgrounds are from the first sound novel and as such give it a nostalgic value (for those who played the first game), it doesn't clash too badly with the new sprites, but updating them would've been nice, to at least match the updated sprites better. The UI is the same UI as the first game, it doesn't really need to be changed functionality wise more so get a cleaner and more modern look, its simple and effective (which I like) but giving it a newer, more polished and cleaner look would've been great. I have heard of a PS3 patch, but i dont like messing with/modding and possibly breaking the game (a far to common problem with New Vegas and other games, though to a different scale, considering this is a sound novel) and no voices are fine with me, it doesn't take away from any of the characters since i havent listened to their anime voices that much nor any of their updated game voices. No complaints about the sprites, love them. Would do the patch for the updated backgrounds, but then i have to do everything else in the patch, which i don't feel like doing. Glad i grabbed it on sale, but $5 maybe $6 max seems like a good price point for this sound novel series, hoping Mangagamer doesn't get too greedy. There are also very minor translation issues, does not take away from the game, but is a nuance when first seen. I would also now like to point out the weird use of censoring later in the game, not in the tips but in the actual dialogue or Monologue.
and my time with it is because i keep leaving it open when I sleep xD.

18619386.review:
Higurashi Ch1, covers the first chapter of the Higurashi series  (which for anime-only fans, would be I think episode 1 to episode 5 or 6).    The story starts off odd, but then has a ncie 'slice of school life' feel to it.   Well,  thats where it sets you up for thinking that this will be a nice, happy story with no horror at all.  But thats where it starts because about half way through, you learn of a few, mysterious events and eventually, certain people die and well, I can't say too much more since it would spoil things and even the ending of Ch 1 leading to Ch2 is a spoiler in itself.     


What Higurashi does best at, is telling a story that sets things up for future reference and by that, I mean that there are things that are said that might not seem like much, but will later get revealed as having a deeper or darker meaning to it.  I'm struggling to write a good review since I'm very very much a Higurashi fan since I've read all the VN for the main series, watched al the animes, and well yeah.   


Anyway, to put it short, Hgiurashi, is an amazing horror and psychological visual novel that is perfect for those who enjoy a good, kind of slow paced story.  The visuals of the characters are new and pretty, the sounds and music are kept from the original version, and thebackgrounds have been enhanced.   Its an amazing VN and anime that I highly HIGLY recomend watching it.  And if that doesn't get you hyped to read it, then watch this OP for the anime

18565150.review:
Ironically enough, good horror can often serve as an escape. When you're fully immersed in a state of mind where your attention is drawn, or rather forced towards a source of fear and terror, the unpleasantness serves to pull your mind away from a life of deadlines, chores and unfulfillment. In that sense, it's a lot like drenching bland food in plenty of hot sauce - sure, your mouth may sting to high heaven, but at least you don't have to taste what you're eating.

In that sense, Onikakushi drew me in hard. The premise isn't anything that original (an insular country town with a dark history harbours an unpleasant secret that you stumble upon by chance) but the execution is exceptional. The degree to which it pulls you into the psychological state of doubt, terror, helplessness, paranoia and delusion is so extensive that I experienced horrible acid flashbacks at no less than four points in the story. By the time it was over, I felt tangible relief.

The main plot takes a while to get going - the buildup takes up almost half the story and is composed almost entirely of dumb anime tropes, if that sort of thing might turn you off (personally, I'm fine with it), but the payoff is well worth it. I'd highly recommend this, especially at so cheap a price.

18338145.review:
A port of an old but good visual novel.  It's slow to get started because it spends time developing the characters but the story is an intriguing one.  It's from the mystery/horror genre so take that into account.  Also this is a prologue to the series plus part of the question arc(the story is split into two broad arcs called the question arc and the answer arc with multiple chapters in each arc) meaning that it'll leave you with lots of questions.  Clues are given about the truth but not enough for you to actually resolve it(unless of course you've already seen the anime and/or manga that are based on this game). 

One thing to note, this is strictly a visual novel, there are no decisions to make in it at all, no minigames, nothing other than a story to read.  Personally I had no problem with that but it could matter to some people.

18220801.review:
This is coming from someone who considered the anime a personal favorite. The Visual Novel is so much better.

First, there's the content. If you're a fan of Higurashi, chances are you know there are around 8 arcs in the main story. This one covers the first arc, Onikakushi. While this means you'll have to wait for the other arcs (if they ever get released on Steam), this will eat up a good chunk of hours to finish. This is a lot more compared to the four episodes in the anime, which has around 4 episodes in its first arc. 

Also, almost all of the content serves some purpose, whether its building relationships between characters, or showing the thoughts behind them that tear them apart. The story is pretty well-written, and while it does take some time for things to get serious, when it does, it's really good. I should probably also mention sound design. It contributes really well to the atmosphere, especially during some of the more tense moments. One moment you'll be hearing happy slice-of-life music, and the next, you'll be hearing ominous piano pieces with cicadas in the background. It's kind of hard to get immersed in the more frightening parts without sound, so I recommend not reading it on mute.

Usually when this thing is on sale, it's around a dollar or two off, so there's no big need to wait until a sale hits. That being said, hope you enjoy it!

Ci sarebbero davvero tante cose da dire su Higurashi, ma mi limiterò a scriverne poche (anche perchè sono già presenti delle recensioni dettagliatissime in italiano, la mia sarebbe soltanto superflua).
Comincio col dirvi che mi sono avvicinata a questa Novel, tanto da volerla giocare, perchè un po' di anni fa ho visto l'anime e sono rimasta scioccata (nonostante i disegni non fossero perfetti, occhi troppo grandi che occupavano 3/4 della faccia tanto per fare un esempio e personaggi che sembravano diversi ad ogni inquadratura) da quanto fosse terrificante e allo stesso tempo devastante interiormente la sua storia. In questa versione possiamo dire che i vari personaggi sono disegnati benissimo, sarà più facile immedesimarsi nella storia visto che in alcune scene sono esattamente come ve li immaginereste. Il gioco non è doppiato, i testi li potrete leggere completamente in inglese (non ci sono in italiano, quindi non compratelo se non ci capireste un'acca visto che è quello il fulcro).
In alcuni punti continuavo a controllare se ci fosse qualcuno alle mie spalle, vi consiglio di giocarci a luci spente e con le cuffie, ne varrà sicuramente la pena~ ❤

-2016/04/11:
OSX El Capitanでは起動はするが”HigurashiEp01.app”がフリーズ。
アクティビティモニターでは応答なしになってしまった。
Steamオーバーレイを無効にするとプレイ可能。


Higurashi When They Cry - Ch1. Onikakushi(ひぐらしのなく頃に 鬼隠し編)
１作目にあたる作品です。詳しい事は他のユーザーの方々がレビューで解説しておりますのでそちらにおまかせします。

実際のプレイですが、ユーザーが何か選択するこもなくただマウスでクリックしていくだけで終わりますし、
TIPSやExtraの打ち上げをすべて見れは実績はすべて解除(100%)になります。
立ち絵も設定からオリジナル版と新規のどちらかを選べます。

Mac版では不具合があります。
(この不具合がすべてのMacで起きるとは限りませんが一応記しておきます。)

問題は、BGMの再生速度が通常よりも倍の速度で再生している不具合です。仮想マシン上のWindows版で確認した所
この問題はありませんでした。まあこの程度は個人的には気にしないのでそのまま最後までプレイしました。
気になる方はBGMを設定からオフにすればいいかと。

続編が出るか今のところ不明ですが気長に待とうかと思います。

17975089.review:
Higurashi: When They Cry is a fantastic sound novel - notice I didn't say visual novel, since while it is technically the most visual and novelly a VN can get, there are absolutely zero choices or alternate paths. No gameplay. It's a novel... with sound. And pictures.
Speaking of the pictures though, this includes both the original art from the first release of the game and some new art as well, with a quick and easy way to switch between them. It also includes a much better translation than the first release.
Honestly, I feel like I've been spoiled by the anime, since the novel feels slow paced now.
I'd highly recommend this game... if the anime weren't around. As it is, I can only really recommend it to Higurashi buffs who want to see where it all began.

Anyway, the patch is amazing and even though it doesn't fix the text problem, the background graphics give the game a MUCH more professional feel, and the addition of voices makes it so that the text doesn't feel so... clunky. Однозначно, могу сказать, что сия визуальная новелла держится на очень даже приличном уровне.

Подача сюжета лаконичная и понятная. Фабула интересная и интригующая. Перипетии истории заставят немного пораскинуть мозгами. Также, хотелось бы отметить отличную детективную составляющую, которая заставит как можно скорее прочитать сию историю до конца, от корки до корки. 

Хоть я и ознакомился с данной визуальной новеллой после просмотра первого сезона аниме-сериала "Higurashi no Naku Koro ni" и части второго, мне, всё же, было интересно углубиться в подробности и познать нераскрытые аспекты истории, что были представлены в аниме версии.

Добавлю, что эта новелла идёт как пролог ко всей истории серии "Higurashi no Naku Koro ni". Так что, хотелось бы вскоре увидеть следующие игры данной вселенной в Steam.

17735759.review: Jeśli oczekujesz interaktywnej gry, w której masz wybór na przebieg wydarzeń - Higurashi nie jest pozycją dla ciebie. Pierwszy rozdział jest w zasadzie wprowadzeniem do serii When They Cry, pozostawiający więcej pytań niż odpowiedzi. Dla osoby która oglądała anime i grała w Umineko (czy When They Cry 3 jak kto woli), te kilkanaście godzin było miłym odświeżeniem pokręconej historii jaką Higurashi zdecydowanie jest. W stosunku do oryginalnej visual novel wprowadzono parę zmian - wyglądu postaci (na plus, chociaż Tomitake wygląda bardziej jak brat Burnejki niż fotograf) oraz ścieżki dźwiękowej (tu brakowało mi oryginalnej muzyki z menu wskazówek, była bardziej klimatyczna). Czy polecam tą grę innym osobom? Jak najbardziej. Dla fanów anime poszerzy ona to, co nie mogło się zmieścić w 20-minutowych odcinkach, a fanom horrorów pokaże, że można stworzyć historię z dreszczykiem bez masy jumpscarów.

17589619.review:
TL;DR  Story 7/10
Punctuation 4/10
I wanted to give this a thumbs down--but the story is good.  The first 30% is mind-numbing drivel. How do they expect readers to get to the real story, by sitting through that?  My first VN before this was Sword of Asumi.  It may have been a ridiculous detective case to figure out.  Still, there were choices to be made in that story to make it interesting.  Higurashi is a spacebar VN--no choices.

I can forgive some of the translation problems.  The older female student kept referring to herself as "this old man"--a cultural colloquialism?

Still, punctuation should be better than a third-grader could do.  There is a reason why we invented the quotation marks.  The MC talks to himself many times and quite a few times quotation marks were not used when he was speaking out load.  Also, when 5 people are speaking in a room, you need to indicate who is speaking; otherwise, it becomes very confusing as to who is saying what.
Sat: "This"
Rena: "That"
Tell me who is talking. "This" "That" "and more."  How does the reader know that the same person is talking?  This is editing that could have been done by a sixth-grade editor.  Hire one next time.

Ugh. Skip the Prologue: All-Cast Review Session. They pretend to be a book club discussing the story, whether a curse was logically involved. It is complete garbage.

17492033.review:
Autant être clair dès le début, je suis un fan de l'animé dont est tiré ce jeu. Je risque donc de ne pas être super objectif ^^

Higurashi est un sound novel: un roman intéractif basé dont l'ambiance sonore a une très grande importance. Nous suivons l'histoire de Maebara Keiichi, un jeune homme qui a emménagé dans le petit village reculé de Hinamizawa. Il s'y fait rapidement des amies et rejoint leur groupe de jeu. Il y coule des jours tranquille jusqu'à ce qu'il découvre quelque chose qui le plonge dans une histoire sombre dans laquelle ses amies sont peut-être directement impliqué. Je ne dirais rien de plus pour éviter les spoils.
Lorsque j'ai lancé Higurashi la première fois, le design des personnages et l'ambiance est très mignonne et on se laisse vite prendre par l'ambiance fort sympathique du petit groupe. Jusqu'à ce que tout dérape et bascule dans l'horreur et la folie.
Etant basé sur le son, il a évidemment une bande sonore vraiment bonne et les diférents évènements sont vraiment bien décrits.  Bref, je le conseil FORTEMENT pour les fans du genre et aux fans de l'animé qui ont envie de toucher au jeu qui est la source de petit bijou.

Juste un tout petit point négatif selon moi: uniquement en anglais

Bon voyage dans l'horreur!

17405210.review:
Disclaimer: This is a horror story, and it's not for the faint of heart. Seeing the story through to the end will keep your interest piqued and waiting anxiously for chapter 2. Despite the dark ending, there is a scene afterwards in the extras section that provides some much needed denouemont.

Higurashi is not so much a game, or even a choose-your-own-story game, but a strictly linear narrative (a Kinetic Novel). That might sound disapointing to some, but it uses surprisingly effective writing, artwork, music, and sound effects to balance both levity and growing tension. It even controls the pace of the dialogue to ensure that jokes and terrifying revelations are delivered at the right moment.

I don't want to describe what's going on because discovery is part of the fun of a good mystery or horror story, so I'll leave you with some of the things I learned from Higurashi: 

- A happy childhood is a wonderful thing to have. Cherish it while you have it, or at least help others experience it.
- Life is like a game you play where the other players don't give you all the rules up front, including the following rule.
- If your opponents set out to win by any means necessary, you must match them.
- Even the greatest of fortunes can be reversed instantly.
- Today's adversaries can become tomorrow's friends, and vice versa.
- Fight with all your might. 
- Always think outside the box and around the problem.
- When someone warns you that you are asking too many questions, you just might be. Ask yourself if your life depends on you NOT knowing the answers you seek.
- Girls are scary when they get mad. DON'T ---- WITH THEM. (or, Hell hath no fury...)
- Know who your real friends are. Stick by them when they need you. Forgive them when they've hurt you, for your sake as well as your own.
- If you think either that people are out to get you, that you are cursed by a supernatural force, or that you're simply having a psychotic episode, drop what you're doing and get help. 


 I dare you to play this game late at night, in the dark, when you should be asleep...

I came into this expecting to be a dark and terrifying murder mystery, and I'm watching a bunch of schoolgirls play games...

Well... I'm glad I had this "thing" for free because it is awfull. It is a visual novel with NO choice to make. I thought it would be a bit like telltales games. Or at least some choices between phrases... but no. 

It really IS a sound novel (And a bad one for sure).
But even with this in mind... It's awful.
A novel (badly written - maybe badly translated). I've "played" only 25 minutes. 25 minutes of small talk about the weather and other boring matters between some underdeveloped characters. Flat and repetitive dialogue. And the "sound" part is awful. It sounds like some free sound effects you can find on the internet.
This first chapter is supposed to be a 10 hours chapters. I suffered enough reading the first 25 minutes (Went to school, see 4 girls, than go see temple and picknick... That kind of things are nice in real life... and COULD be nice in a novel if the character had some motive of were interesting...)

I see in that the comments are pretty positive about this "game". You might need to be already a fan of the manga to appreciate this. Anyways, that's just my honest opinion. If you wan't a nice story, grab a real book from a real writer.

"...Shaved ice cream eating race ... I ... I can't !"
"As long as you can melt it a bit with your body heat, then...!! It's...! so coOoOoold!!!"

17088094.review:
On the one hand, when it gets going, this is actually a tense little thriller and it's pretty dense with prose.

On the other, there is no interactivity whatsoever*, and the opening chapters really do feel like they were transported from another, worse VN, because the opening scene already tells us we're going dark, then you have about 4.5 chapters of SCHOOL HIJINKS/THE LOCAL PRAYER FESTIVAL to get through before anything intriguing happens again. And again: dense chapters. To top it off, while this does have its own conclusion, it is still part one of a larger story and leaves you with a bunch of dangling plot threads, which is infuriating when the future translations are ??? off.

I feel like I'm half-damning this when I say I would have preferred to just read this as a novel, but it really did get me to press on through, so it's not like it's the worst thing I've played in the genre.

* Technically you can look at "additional documents/conversations" after certain chapters, but you make absolutely no plot decisions. The game continues on with absolutely no input from you required at any point.

I don't read manga (sorry) but the anime version of Higurashi is my favorite one so far, which means I've put quite a lot of thought behind this. Examples of why this is better than the anime is because of details. In the anime you get to know what the characters do and don't and such. In the visual novel you experience what they experience, you feel the emotions of the characters, you experience the story in a different way. I recommend this game if you want to get a new experience, a new story to read or just simply try something completely new. 9/10

17038539.review: Higurashi is all about the juxtaposition of those cheerful, carefree moments and the utter isolation of paranoia. The story doesn't progress from one to the other quickly either as you've noted, preferring instead to lead you along the characters' slow descent into frantic and obsessive terror. You might not even notice it at the moment, but the seeds of mistrust are already planted and beginning to grow at the point of the story where you are. Things are set in motion to snowball into the dark terror you expected, and when you get there it will (at least, the idea is that it will) carry that much more impact because of the time taken showing you what the characters are like when they aren't bludgeoning each other to death as well as what brought them to that point.

TL;DR:(8/10)  a pretty good psych/horror/mystery visual novel that starts out pretty dry then revs up pretty fast only to end up as sequel bait..(sequel bait that i do not mind falling for honestly..)and reminds you that its a prolouge. 

I won't go to spoilery becuase thts all this is, story. One that horror fans should expereince.This was my first entrance into the series. Not knowing what to expect, i found the first few few chapters of so to be pretty dry. It seemed like a slice of life sort of deal UNTIL the watanagashi. This is the turning point of the story and things start to hit the fan from there. CH.1 starts to sweep some characters under the rug and i was kinda intrested to see how they would play into the whole "shit hitting fan" situation..but was sad to see they did not get much mention in the later chapters. The horror was pretty intense and the sounds lended themselves pretty nicely, adding diffrent audio distortions really tingled my spine and the overall mystery of what was going on made me keep reading. I kept reading only to be kinda disapointed by the ending..The ending wasn't bad (its pretty dark but not terrible at all) but it jut didn't answer questions that needed answers! After compleing the story the first time, you unock a little "cast party" thing, which was SUPER great to see and was a really nice pallete cleanser to the events that just hit me like a ton of bricks. (You will all see why if you choose to ake the purchase.)
 I really do recomed this VN to anyone who wants to a good mystery..but know that it's just a prolouge with little to no answers in it's conclusion and that there shall be more to come..whenever that may be..please let it be soon..(also that cast party was fantastic imo)

16905822.review:
Summary: Surprisingly, much more feeling than the anime.

This is the first visual novel I've played, and boy was I surprised!  I'm an anime person rather than a manga person, because I like listening to Japanese voices and watching the gainaxing, among other things.  I expected a visual novel to be a step down from anime, but maybe a step above manga.  I could not be more wrong; playing Higurashi as a visual novel felt much better than watching the anime!  I don't mind that the anime is kinda low budget compared to other popular animes, and I enjoyed it very much.  However, I enjoyed the visual novel much more.  I got more attached to the characters in the visual novel, which made it much more engaging and feelsy.  Also, it is a very different experience playing as Keiichi, rather than watching everyone in the third person.  Reading his every thought is an important part of Higurashi that wasn't as strong in the anime.  My feelings regarding Ooishi were totally different in the visual novel.
Having sprites instead of animation does not detract from a story at all.  For Higurashi, it made the characters get under my skin even more.  Anyone who is an anime or manga enthusiast should definitely try this game.  Anyone who likes Amnesia and thinks they might enjoy visual novels shoud also try this game.

16879666.review:
This is the prologue.
鬼隠し編の単体売り。どうなのかなとは思うが一応オススメの方に票を入れておきます。

本作は最初から最後まで選択肢の分岐が無い一本道ストーリーのデジタルノベルです。
もう10年以上前に彗星の如く登場し一世を風靡したシリーズだけあって
ストーリーには相応の魅力があります。
私は当時の原作で全編を読了済なので今回のSteam版では再読となります。

Steam版の良い点はまずちゃんと日本語が収録されてる事。
わざわざ日本語が抜かれてるケースも多いSteam界隈ですから
ちゃんと日本語が収録されている時点でプラス評価です。
次に立ち絵が一新されている事がとても大きいです。
オプションで昔の立ち絵に戻す事が出来るのも原作を尊重している姿勢が伺えてプラス評価出来ます。

問題点は鬼隠し編単体の売り方。
これから初めて読んでみようと思ってる方はこの鬼隠し編だけだと
相当長い間モヤモヤ状態のお預けを喰らう事になります。
全編出揃ってから読み始めた方が良いと思います。
セールで安かったりした時に買って積んでおけば良いです。

また本作の特徴として日常編の描写が退屈に感じてしまう人も居るかもしれません。
日常の描写があるからこそ凄惨な描写への振幅が生まれて
ストーリーに刺激が増すから無駄な存在ではないと言えるのですが
日常描写がだるくて読むのを止めてしまった人というのも過去に居ました。
ですので本作に興味を持った方はこういった部分も含めて
世界観描写を楽しみたいという気持ちを持てれば
鬼隠し編やこれから先もきっと満足出来ると思います。
一本道ですので読了まではプレイ時間の通りです。

16853589.review:
As a fan of the anime, I decided to check this out. I remember watching the 2nd season when it was currently airing and having an episode be cancelled due to an axe murder in Japan. Nostalgic times. Nice boat–wait, that’s School Days.

Higurashi takes a while to start, but what makes it amusing to me is how cute and innocent it all is in the beginning. Compared to other visual novels, this one is linear with no routes or choices for you to choose, so there is no need to worry about making mistakes. The point of saving is merely to bookmark.

Backgrounds are photographs with filters applied to them, but I recently learned this is quite common with VNs, especially if they’re older such as Higurashi(2002). Those who are bothered by it should install the PS3 mod. I played without it, but wish I knew about it earlier. 

The game is mostly character portraits and text. There aren’t pictured scenes that depict crucial moments in the story, but Higurashi is more of a sound novel than a visual novel, I think. Sound novels rely more on sound effects and text. I think it’s great if you can be spooked just by a description and a sound cue. I have a bit of a guilty pleasure for them. Other sound novels I would recommend are Banshee’s Last Cry(Kamaitachi no Yoru), 999: Nine Hours, Nine Persons, Nine Doors, and Virtue’s Last Reward. A horror VN I would recommend in general is Saya no Uta, but that has um.. H-scenes.

Anyways some people might not like the story or think it’s over the top ridiculous. That’s fine. This is just the prologue and everything is going to get crazier from here on out.

16850165.review: There is a rather severe contrast between the updated sprites and the background...but the enhanced music does enhance the experience. I recommend this game because while the improvements are a bit lackluster, it is one of the only ways you can buy the english version legally. And let's not forget that this is Higurashi and this purchase might supports the release plan of the other 13 Higurashi games in Steam.

16850058.review:
There is more than one way to induce fear in a gamer.
The easiest is simply to mention the words "uplay" or "GFWL".
The second easiest way is to include jump scares, which are to the horror genre as fart jokes are to comedy.
This game does none of those.
It builds a nice image of a friendly village in 1980's Japan, and then turns the town of your dreams into a waking nightmare.
This is, without a doubt, part one of  the scariest visual novel series ever written.
I'll admit that it does have it's flaws, mainly that it takes a bit too long to get to the scary parts, and several other flaws inherent in the visual novel medium, but they don't seriously detract from the game.
It's also a mystery visual novel, and if you haven't been spoiled yet, you'll be guessing all the way until the final chapter (which has yet to be released).
All in all, I really enjoyed myself while reading this visual novel, and you enjoy yourself too.
As for price, I can reccomend buying this game at full price. Normally, I have a rule that I won't buy games unless they are at least 66% off (one only needs to see how many games I own on steam to see how well this has worked),  but for this game I broke my rule and I don't regret it in the slightest.

tl;dr:
An absolute masterpiece of a horror/mystery visual novel. Worth it a full price.

16843376.review:
Fantastic visual novel. Behind the deceitfully happy setting and atmosphere at the beginning of the story, lies an unsettling, disturbing and very intriguing story. Since not all chapters are out on Steam yet, i recommend watching both main seasons of the Higurashi anime to get the full understanding of what's going on, and just to overall enjoy a very well crafted story! 

I don't think the visual novel is as good as the anime however, and that's mostly because of the rather shoddy translation. It's perfectly understandable, but its obvious that a lot of things were literally translated, so the structure of certain sentences isn't too good. Keiichi, the protagonist, also tends to ramble on and on in a lot of cases, and his questions about what's happening around him quickly become redundant, and i'd wish the game would move on sooner than it normally does with certain things.

Nevertheless, this is a good starting point for Higurashi newbies, just to get a little taste of what's Higurashi about, and maybe it'll encourage you to go and watch more of the story via different sources. I wholeheartedly recommend this.

If you don't know the anime, I do recommend you to play this anyway. Don't be decieved by the slow start, this is a horror visual novel that will send actual chills down your spine. Read it with headphones, in the dark, in a comfy chair... it will be an evening not easily forgotten ;)

Higurashi does not fuck around from the start.
It makes things clear that its NOT your average slice of life with potatoe girls.
The begining is jarring. Like what if Ore Monogatari started with a NTR scene.
It does not say explicitly what is going on "Who is dead, why, how."
All you get is touching retrospect of the departed capitalized by the swift THWACK.

The story can be slow to start but it has alot of quality of life improvements to help with pacing.
I fucking love the tips system. It gives you extra backstory and explanations separate from the main story.
Sometimes aluding to future events to get you filling in the horrible blanks.
Not stuff I would skip but if your going for a 2nd reading it will save you abunch of time.

Your gang of friends at school are well rounded if slightly.. off?
Before the festival kicks off there are these little things in dialoge that seem wrong.
And not like a botched translation I mean certain ways your friends talk can be abit uncanny.
Theres this weird dark undertone that seeps into everything. 
Even when the story has some downtime and releases some tension it never goes all the way back down.
The longed I read the more often I had to take a break, its not something you should binge.

That kinda leads back into the hook of the story.
If that start was not there, the THWACK, the thoughts of suicide..
How many people would have finished the story?
Its not just "HAY THIS IS HORROR." but "Get yourself a healthy tolerance for paranoia because we are gonna ride til the wheels fall off."

10/10 Please give me a release date on the next chapter.

16769915.review:
Never being a fan of visual novels, I was dubious about this one.  But by the time it was over, I fully understood how powerful a medium this has the potential to be.  I was astonished at how unsettled I felt at certain points in the story, and I felt genuine dread the more things proceeded.

It does take a while for the craziness to start; you spend a lot of time with the characters in ordinary daily activities, but this actually serves to solidify your connection to them, making it all the more harrowing when things start going wrong.  So, take your time, get immersed, and you will be in for a thrilling treat.  And at $6, it's a total steal.

You, who are reading this. Please uncover the truth. That is my only desire.

The "When they cry" series is not anything new, it has been around for quite a while (over a decade if memory serves). Starting with the visual novels and then the anime. Looking at the previews it looks to be a slightly cutesy series (even from a Graphic Novel perspective) but let me assure you it is not. The Higurashi series is not the most happy one, but it is in my experiences one of the most compelling mystery stories out there. The more you read the deeper you delve into the story the better it gets. It feels a bit slow at first but it picks up.

As others have mentioned the average person looking into this will see "Chapter 1" and think to themselves "Well I don't know about this". This is just part one of many in the series and each Chapter isn't exactly short. 

Another thing worth mentioning is that this version of the visual novel lets you choose between updated character art and original character art. The updated character art is very very good, the screenshots show this. 

Remember that this is a Visual Novel, you don't get to "pick your path" through the story, there are no "Quick-time events" or anything such as that. Think of it like a picture book, a mystery theme'd story rich picture book.

Take your time reading and have fun.

16711119.review:
[h1]Recensione[/h1]
[code] Higurashi When They Cry Hou - Ch.1 Onikakushi[/code]

Da grandissimo fan di Umineko, di certo non potevo lasciarmi scappare questa perla uscita da poco su steam.
Inizialmente rilasciato nel 2002 Higurashi: no Naku Koro ni divenne ben presto una delle opere horror/mistery più conosciute all'interno del mondo delle VN. Pian piano si è fatto strada anche attraverso l'universo dell'animazione e dei manga diventando così uno dei piedistalli dell'horror moderno.
Premetto che, al contrario di Umineko, non avevo mai avuto modo di giocare alla Novel (O anche di leggere il manga, se per questo) e l'esperienza che ho avuto è stata, decisamente, incredibile.


Iniziamo dunque con i miei soliti fattori positivi e negativi riguardati l'opera:

★Fattori Positivi:
-La trama è avvincente ed eccitante, ma sopratutto COINVOLGENTE. Ogni capitolo vi porterà a voler leggere quello successivo, alla ricerca di nuove informazioni che possano aiutarvi a decifrare cosa diamine stia succedendo, veramente, in Hinamizawa.
-I personaggi sono ben strutturati e vi legherete facilmente a loro. Riescono davvero a suscitare alcune emozioni reali all'infuori di voi, sopratutto se siete immersi nella storia.
-6 euro. Più o meno 15 ore di gioco. Se aspettate lo sconto ancora meno. Worth 100%.
-MODDING. Si, esatto, MODDING. Tra le poche recensione negative che ho letto, quasi tutti si lamentavano del fatto che la versione PS2 era decisamente migliore, con le voci, i suoni, e delle CG decisamente migliori. Il tutto è facilmente "fixabile" grazie ad un gruppo di ragazzi, il quale post trovere nella sezione discussioni del gioco, i quali hanno reso possibile aggiungere tutte queste cose alle versione di steam. Ora, fatemi precisare, qui è semplicemente questione di gusto, quindi personale. Volete giocare con le vecchie CG? Potete. Volete giocare con quelle remasterizzate da steam? Potete. Volete giocare con le voci, i suoni e le CG della versione PS2? POTETE.

★Fattori Negativi:
-La traduzione non è proprio perfetta... ma niente di troppo grave.
-NON ESISTE IN ITALIANO O IN QUALSIASI ALTRA LINGUA, quindi sappiate che è tutto in inglese (Non lo considero proprio un fattore negativo, ma vabbeh)
-Signori e Signore, qui stiamo parlando di Ryukishi, quindi aspettatevi un inizio lento e calmo(Direi all'incirca le prime 3-4 ore) che non sembra avere niente a che fare con l'horror e il mistery (Anche questo non lo considero di per se un fattore negativo, ma un sacco di gente si lamentava proprio di questa cosa... quindi meglio avvertire, no? E poi, se non reggete questo, non provate nemmeno ad iniziare la VN di Umineko... no sul serio, è ancora più lento li)

Riassumendo il tutto.. un incredibile opera che non potrà che stupirvi e affascinarvi.
Il mio giudizio?
9/10.
Must buy.
Mi scuso per tutti gli errori grammaticali che avrò fatto, ma non sono un gran scrittore x°
Ma ehi, Nipah~ <3
Ah, se siete come me  e avete un cuore tenero, preparate tanti fazzoletti, perchè PIANGERETE. E TANTO.

16703232.review:
Higurashi When They Cry is a psychological horror visual novel which originally released in Japan in 2002.  Onikakushi is the first chapter in the saga.  Set in 1983, the story follows Keiichi Maebara as he and his parents move to the quiet, rural village of Hinamizawa.  As he settles into his new school and befriends his classmates, Keiichi begins to hear of some gruesome murders that happened in the town a few years prior to his arrival and is naturally interested to find out more.  What started out as innocent curiosity leads Keiichi further into a dangerous town conspiracy, and as the paranoia sets in, he soon discovers that those closest to him may be the very ones he should be running from.

[h1]Plot/Writing:[/h1]
Higurashi When They Cry is praised as one of the best visual novels out there for a reason, and this port does an excellent job of portraying its well-written dialogue to a western audience.  Few visual novels present the genuine sense of paranoia, loneliness and vulnerability that Higurashi does, and fans of psychological horror should look no further since this game acts as a stunning example of the genre and then some.

[h1]Art:[/h1]
You have two options when it comes to character portraits; the original art from the game's first release or the brand new art exclusive to this port.  The latter is set as the default and I highly recommend keeping it that way; the art is slick, clean and presents the characters and their emotions well.  I'd even go so far as to say the art is more polished in this version than in the recently released PS3 port of the game.

[h1]Sound:[/h1]
Higurashi When They Cry and the later-released Umineko When They Cry are both described as 'sound novels' by their creators; meaning that there is a heavy emphasis on the sound effects and background music of each scene.  This is especially true for Higurashi; the ambience of the country village of Hinamizawa is forever set with the constant chirping of the cicadas in almost every scene, and the background music can go from incredibly bouncy to downright chilling in seconds.

[h1]Flaws:[/h1]
Higurashi When They Cry could be easily criticised for its incredibly slow opening.  Although this serves to simply make the player feel connected to the characters before the horror scenes take place, many people could grow tired and give up reading before it gets good.  Not until midway into the chapter does the pacing pick up to the point where the game becomes too good to put down.  Furthermore, unlike other visual novels, there are no choices to be made, branching paths to discover or multiple endings to see; it is pure reading from start to finish, and although this is essentially what a visual novel is anyway, the complete absence of player interaction could be seen as a flaw.

[h1]TL;DR:[/h1]
[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*]Fantastic writing; easily one of the best visual novels of the genre
[*]Truly chilling horror scenes are worth waiting for
[*]Polished, sleek character art that complements the story well
[*]Sound effects and soundtrack work together well to add to the tension
[*]10-15 hours of reading content is worth the cost of entry
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*]Very slow opening could make players lose interest quickly
[*]Zero player interaction unlike other visual novels could hurt player interest
[/list]

Let's hope the next chapter releases soon!

As an avid fan of the Higurashi series, having read the entire original visual novel and having watched the anime adaptation twice, I can most definitely recommend this masterpiece of a story to anyone who likes a well-written and deep mystery story combined with horror and a fantastic atmosphere and suspense!

The story is gripping and exciting, making you eagerly wait for what's coming up next, and urging you to find out an explanation for all of the creepy and terrifying events that keep teasing you with their ambiguous meanings. The characters are well-written and really make you sympathize with them. They really elicit some real emotions out of you, especially if you're immersed, which the story's atmosphere itself delivers very well! The way the story builds a bond between you and the characters works really effectively especially when things start to get sinister, as such, it starts out all nice and slow but keeps you intrigued with bits and pieces of creepy foreshadowing events at a good pace, and gets increasingly screwed up the more you get into it! It finishes in a way that really makes you want more and look eagerly forward to the next chapter.

Give it a read and immerse yourself in the mysterious, frightening and thrilling story of Higurashi - When They Cry!

16639256.review:
Higurashi es como una novela de Stephen King. Al principio todo se centrará en su ambiente, se nos introducirá dónde estamos, quién somos, y quiénes son los que nos rodean. Una vez que éstas bases estén bien pavimentadas, comenzará el verdadero desarrollo de una trama  que es tan sumamente angustiante como fascinante.

Sin embargo, no es para todos. Aquellos menos pacientes podrán fácilmente aburrirse ni bien pasada la primera hora de juego (O novela, para ser justos, pues no hay ningun tipo de interacción más que permitir que la historia continue) y ésto se debe a que si bien, en su punto más álgido el ritmo de los acontecimientos es frenético, toma aproximadamente unas 4 o 5 horas para que se nos presente el verdadero conflicto.

Aun así...No puedo dejar de recomendar Higurashi a todo el mundo. Es una historia sobre un misterio tan sobrecogedor que te envuelve lentamente hasta devorarte por completo, momentos que contienen muy buenas dosis de humor, personajes sumamente carismáticos, una atmosfera excelentemente ejecutada  y una historia inolvidable que además goza de estar brillantemente bien escrita.

Una pena que no exista traducción al Español, y si no tienes un muy buen nivel de inglés es probable que tengas muchas dificultades a la hora de afrontar sus 10 horas de duración, por lo que se hace imprescindible tener un diccionario a mano (Lo cual además puede arruinar un poco la experiencia).

Sin embargo dejando de lado sus "contras", te invito a un lugar en el que nada es lo que parece, donde la amistad y la confianza intentan luchar contra un poder que va más allá de la comprensión. Un lugar en dónde las cigarras han visto demasiado.

El lugar en el que ellas lloran.

16405317.review:
[h1][u]Quick[/u]: See where it all began with the Higurashi VN! For those who loved the anime/manga series, this will be fun to play. [/h1]

Detail:
[u]Pros[/u]:
+ Can switch between the new and old artwork 
+ New artwork is very nicely done.
+ Lots of save spots for your game.
+ Can switch between English and Japanese.
+ A VN that has lots of hours of play. (played 10.2 hours)
+ Had 12 chapters/parts to go through to get to the end.
+ An exciting story that keeps you glued in for most of it.
+ Atmosphere conveyed quite well through music and art.
+ Achievements ,that if you enjoy the story, are quite easy to get.
+ Learn more info through T.I.P.S
+ No grammatical errors found from first read through.
+ For those who love the anime, will be a treat :)
+ Different poses for characters.
+ Game isn't really expensive
+ Writing is not bad :) Goes into fairly good detail
+ (Depending on your own perspective: Has no Voice Acting)

[u]Cons[/u]:
-Based off of other VN I've went through, would have been nice to have those full images to see instead of just individual character poses all the time. Think that would have made a scarier element to it than[spoiler] the blotch of blood on the right of the screen. [/spoiler]
-Can become confusing whose talking since text goes over artwork.
-[spoiler]  Felt Keiichi's progression into insanity went slightly too quick into beleiving Oyashiro-sama's curse and going against his friends. [/spoiler]
-Cicada noise drove me nuts after a bit. 
-A lot of reading, though I would have liked choices I could make like other VNs. Just reading through the story, which isn't that bad for me personally, but could be not as good to others who may want to play.
- BG is weird looking. Some looks like it was taken with a photograph then blurred weirdly and than put a photoshop filter on it.
- (Depending on your own perspective: Has no Voice Acting)

[u]Verdict[/u]:
[u]Fans[/u]: If you love the Higurashi anime and/or manga. It would probably be great to check it out. You will learn some more about the story that you may not have already known.

[u]New to series[/u]: If you are okay with just reading, definitely recommend. The writing is not bad and goes into fairly well done detail. If you do not like reading, then you may not be as big of fan. Check out the anime instead if you are interested in the story!

16355031.review:
Avendo apprezzato l'anime a suo tempo e da idolatore di Umineko (stesso circolo doujin), non potevo esimermi dal comprare Higurashi in questa edizione ufficiale per l'occidente.
I punti a favore sono decisamente molti: prezzo basso, tutti i contenuti dell'originale ripuliti e ammodernati, una storia intensa e veramente coinvolgente che sono sicuro tormenterà coloro che non sanno ancora le risposte ai vari misteri.

D'altro canto il porting poteva essere migliore: niente sfondi rifatti, la sola lingua inglese come testi per l'occidente (anche se non è così complesso come si legge in altre recensioni), in particolare la totale assenza di doppiaggio.
Fra i possibili contro invece c'è la lentezza a cui Ryukishi ci ha spesso abituati: determinate scene risultano lunghe e forse poco apprezzabili nell'immediato, anche se nell'economia globale della storia sono irrinunciabili per la splendida caratterizzazione del cast.

Un'opera fra le più conosciute in ambito visual novel e un must per coloro che apprezzano il media. L'uscita a capitoli, inoltre, pur essendo tediosa (ma paritaria alla condizione originale della serie), consente di dilazionare la spesa e avere tutto il tempo per rileggere i capitoli e giocare al detective. Perché questo ci chiede Ryukishi: pensa e cerca di capire cosa è successo prima che te lo sveli io!

16345251.review:
I love the Higurashi franchise. I loved the anime, and I loved the game. This is a game that all Visual Novel fans should at least check out.

Meet Keichii (or as I lovingly refer to him as Keichii-Kun!!), keichii has moved to the small village of Hinamizawa and everything is going fine for him. He made friends, He's well liked by the village, and he joined a cool school club. Then everything changes when he hears about an incident four years ago. And a series of events slowely turns the very life that keichii once knew upside down.

The characters in this story are really well designed in personality (Rena is my favorite :)) and the sound design is pretty good (though there is no fully voice acted characters which honestly would have helped for later scenes involving Rena) there is also plenty of background art too and the new models look very similar to the anime character designs which i consider a plus since its familiar territory.

That said, there are only two complaints i have and even then the game does a good job at countering them, one was the lack of a indication as to who was talking (name over the dialogue, colored text, etc.), but what saves this is how each character has a certain style to how they talk, making it easier to figure out who was talking.

The other complaint is the lack of CGI, something to help the audience imagine what had actually happened, but the scenes are described so vividely that they would almost feel out of place. Also, having watched the Anime also kinda helps.

Seriously though, check this game out, it's only six bucks ;D

16323177.review:
Higurashi is brilliant and creepy. I loved it and I will be thinking about it for a long, long time, but I had to play it in small doses because it was too intense to play for more than a few minutes at a time. If the next chapter ever becomes available, I intend to grab it immediately.

This is not a game. It's a story, like a novel but with sound and music to enhance the mood, and it is excellently effective. It usually lets you advance the text of the story at whatever pace you choose, but sometimes it takes control and makes you pause in anticipation before revealing the next line. That may sound frustrating, but it is only done rarely and only when it makes the story better. You could never get these sorts of amazing effects from reading a mere novel. I strongly recommend that everyone try Higurashi.

The art is fine and does what it needs to do. It would be nice if there were more poses and more backgrounds to more closely follow the story, but that's a trivial issue. On the other hand, it would not have been a trivial issue if the art had not been upgraded from the original version of the game. During the game you have the option of flipping between the new art and the original art, and the original art is terribly goofy and unacceptable. If I need to play the next chapter using the original artwork, then it's not worth playing. Fortunately the new art is in a clean and conventional style without huge cartoonish exaggerations.

The new art takes away Mion's gun. I never understood why Mion wore a gun; it's such a bizarre fashion choice and removing it can only improve the story.

Overall, this is an amazing experience that fixes the serious flaws in the original version and turns it into a masterpiece.
